Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: lyewatarian
Reviews.Content: At check-in was welcomed by Alexandra, who asked what brought us to London, I told her it was my birthday and we were going to the theatre. She upgraded us to a deluxe room on the 9th floor, which was huge and very clean and comfortable. On return to the hotel later in the day, she had arranged for balloons and a delicious chocolate cake adorned with fruit and on a plate with happy birthday written in chocolate along with a card and message. It was a wonderful surprise and added to an already perfect stay. Breakfast was excellent very tasty and lots of choice. Easy to find and lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but quite pricey”
Reviews.Author: Andozer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton Canary Wharf a number of times for work over the past couple of years. Each and every time I have had a pleasant and comfortable stay. The rooms are always a very good size, very clean and modern, no complaints at all. The food too is always very good. The only bad thing is the cost, but that is quite typical for London and Canary Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPhotographer
Reviews.Content: Decided on the location first (Canary Wharf), then chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews, and were not disappointed. Had a slight delay at check-in (staff could not find the reservation until showed the booking confirmation number). Booked a special deal on the standard room, but got a free upgrade to the junior suite. The room is large, with separate living area, king size bed, two large flat screen tv's and large windows with good view. The DLR runs just outside, but it's almost inaudible as the windows have great double-glazing. Checkout was a breeze, took less than 10 seconds. Reserved in advance through booking.com and got the best deal. Would stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel, good underground connection.”
Reviews.Author: Stuttgal
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The service of the staff is great. I got a room on the 10th floor wich was huge, clean, very comfortable. One of the best hiltons I have stayed at. The view to the channel was great. you can walk to the -granted- business area Canary Wharf, where there are lots of restaurants and a small shopping mall. Just a short underground ride from downtown. I stayed during the weekend and it was nice and quiet. I would definitely stayed here again. The only thing that could be better: Internet and breakfast are not free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for London citytrip!”
Reviews.Author: Filiphgd
Reviews.Content: Second time we stayed here. Very nice hotel with spacious and clean rooms. Very friendly staff and great breakfast. We'll be back! One remark: wifi should be free for hotel guests!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, no problems”
Reviews.Author: Clarkey8
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at reception, to be told we had been upgraded to an Executive Room, to the moment we left, there were no issues at all. Fantastic room and bathroom, everything we could have needed. Well done Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Varito
Reviews.Content: Canary Wharf is not a place to stay if you travel to London on vacations, and in my case, since the Regional Headquarters of the company I work for are located there, I travel very frequently. Usually I stay at the Marriott West India Quai, but this time it was fully booked an the company reserved a room for me at the Hilton. It is a very nice hotel for business travellers, spacious room (much bigger than the ones at the Marriott), very clean room and toilett, excellent room-service with a lot of options, and also a very good breakfast. Of course that room service and breakfast are too expensive, but I know it's the rule a this type of hotels. Negative points: Bed - not as comfortable as the ones from the Marriott or other hotels like Sheraton or Intercontinental. Windows - windows are locked in the rooms, and is not possible to open them, not even a bit, which is horrible for people who prefer a bit of fresh air instead of the air conditioning. All in all a good place to stay, which could be much more comfortable it this minor issues are being solved.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for the O2.”
Reviews.Author: Annie5119
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is so close to the O2 (one stop on the Jubilee Line). We had a wonderful stay. The room was huge and spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The DLR runs alongside the hotel and as we were on the third floor, it seemed very close. We could hear it when we were trying to get to sleep. Everything else was perfect. We will definitely stay there again. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VHarryS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in various Hilton hotels around London (and worldwide) and have to say that Hilton Canary Wharf tops them. Impressed every time by the wonderful staff at the Hilton Canary Wharf. The hotel is clean, exactly as you expect it to be and staff always friendly (especially at the Executive lounge level). Great deals at the weekend and perfect location. Thank you for great customer service and we will continue to be loyal Hilton honors members.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: debraj7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights early March. When we checked in we were given a complimentary upgrade to a double deluxe room. All staff we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and spacious, very clean and good bathroom. A wide range of choice for breakfast which was of a high standard, hot food was hot! service on our second day for tea & coffee was a bit slow but not much of a problem to us. The hotel has easy to access to the city within 20 minutes using the underground. There are lots of places to eat in canary wharf along the riverside.My daughter and her boyfriend are staying here in May as they got such a good deal, hope they have as wonderful time as we did. Would stay here again if visiting London without hesitation especially if i could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel service was great”
Reviews.Author: nadz786
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend for two nights.The staff were very polite and the room was very clean definately high standards. The room was incredibly big , bigger than we thought and the view was incredible especially at night. Got a good deal to stay here and was definately worth the money. My only hangup was how expensive everything was at the hotel especially the breakfast which is £21 pp per day!! And the wifi which I thought was free at first then found out it is £22 per day !!! Bit much for wireless in my opinion but overall a very gud stay

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Buns4vs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed on a fair few number of occasions at the Tower Bridge Hilton, but a last minute get together with friends made this a good venue. What a great find!! The boutique feeling of the Hotel is very much like the Tower Bridge Hilton, with similar furnishings and overall design and with the added benefit of the attitude of the staff, you would not think that these are part of a worldwide chain. Turning to the Canary Wharf Hilton, the location is pretty good with access via a footbridge to Canary Wharf Underground Station, rather than opting to walk down the road to the Docklands Light Railway, as the interchange between the DLR and the Tube at Canary Wharf Station actually means you walk further!! The rooms are spacious and the furniture and fittings are all still in good shape; we were fortunate enough to be upgraded due to our Hilton Honours Status and the Executive Rooms here are larger than at Tower Bridge. The Photos here on Trip Advisor do the place justice and give a very good representation of what you get here. The real gem of this Hotel was a very large Executive Lounge with excellent staff and services and a fantastic view of London. I particularly liked the silhouette of the London Skyline etched on the Executive Lounge windows. One tip is that just down the road and across from South Quay Station is a Tescos Supermarket that is open every day (including Sundays) from 7am to 11pm. Very useful for those things you might leave behind All in all this was a great find and will be a strong contender for our repeat visits to London

Reviews.Title: “Great value & service”
Reviews.Author: Shelxmas
Reviews.Content: Just home from a lovley weekend break in Hilton canary wharf. The hotel is a fantastic base for anyone who's visiting London for business or pleasure. The hotel itself is spotless with excellent facilities. The tube & dlr are within 5 mins walk from the hotel which makes doing the touristy things so easy. We opted to get an oyster card which you can top up at any pay as you go depo and found this worked out really well for us. We had access the the executive lounge which was a major plus as we had a decent breakfast there each morning and relaxed there in the evening with a glass of wine. Views from upper floors are fantastic! I could not fault this hotel at all. We will definitly be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Nu-nu-ke
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and my brothers family visited London for a weekend. Rooms were big and very clean. People were extremely nice and helpful. There is nice view, close to shopping center as well as close and easy transport to center of London. My husband arrived earlier, and he was welcomed and let check in far before normal check in time. Thank you and I will definitely recommend my friends your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: InstantGratification
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton while on a leisure trip to UK. Although the stay was for a single night, i got a decent deal while booking(which included breakfast). My partner and I arrived early into London from Paris and reached the hotel before 1 PM. The staff were quite helpful and instantly provided the room thereby saving us the trouble of leaving the luggage and traveling into the city. The early check in was a good start and we made our selves comfortable in the large spacious room. The bed was comfy but at the edge of the bed,one could hear the mattress spring moving around which was a little disconcerting. The views werent that great as there were tall buildings all around, I guess there must be other rooms overlooking the river, so opt for those. The bathrooms were very funcitonal and there was a big tub which was a boon to us as we were dead tired on arrival. The AC was comfortable and although the outside temperature was close to -2 degrees, the room was a cosy 22. My girlfriend wanted to use the internet to get some work done but we were told that it would be 15 pounds for a day's use!! Considering that most hotels these days offer free wireless or atleast a couple of hours of complimentary usage, this was a shock. It was way overpriced and something you dont expect from a hotel in the business district of London. We had a decent morning breakfast, with good options and a spread that is expected from a star hotel like Hilton.The food was fresh and filling. The location is amazing with a 5 min walk from the Canary wharf station on the Jubilee line and is quite safe even at night. There are many options to eat and shop nearby if one wants to explore. Jubilee place is right within the station and there are a few other bars and cafes within walking distance. Overall, a very good option if one wants to stay in Canary Wharf and nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aberwhite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in London for just one night to visit our daughter and had pre-booked back in December on a really good value deal which included breakfast. This was made even better when, on early check-in, we were upgraded to an executive room on the 12th floor. Everyone we encountered from the check-in, bar and breakfast staff were friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and comfortable. Just a pity that we were only in it a relatively short time. The only drawback was that the room was at the front of the hotel - the DLR runs very close to the hotel and can be quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the o2 arena.”
Reviews.Author: WalesGeordie
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay at the hilton canary wharf several months previous to our stay for a concert at the o2 arena. About a week before received an email offering a standby upgrade which i applied for. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite for £39.The room was ready on check in and was excellent and well worth the upgrade.The hilton canary wharf is in an ideal location for the o2 arena just one stop on the tube,if your using this hotel for sightseeing then buy a day ticket for the tube as it saves a fortune,one stop will cost you £4.30 so it soon adds up.The hotel is modern very clean and has very friendly staff.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nadia F
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay in the Hilton hotel. The staff were very friendly on arrival, and prompt in checking us in to our hotel. When i booked the hotel I requested a river view room on a high floor and got exactly that. I was also pleasantly surprised with the personal touches shown by this hotel. I had commented that it was my boyfriend's birthday and that was the reason for our stay there. There were balloons in the bedroom and the Guest Relations Manager brought us a slice of cake each which was a lovely treat. The rooms were very large, surprising for a hotel in London, and very clean with an amazing view over London. The bed was huge with loads of space to sleep comfortably. The pillows were not to my taste so were slightly uncomfortable but otherwise I had a fabulous nights sleep as the room was sooooo quiet. You couldn't hear anything outside or anybody in the corridor. It was wonderful. The breakfast was included in our hotel deal and it was delicious. There was alot of choice, from a fry to cereal and fruit. It's self-service too so you can decide how much or little you have. The hotel seems more like a business hotel but it is perfect for travelling too. It's peaceful location means you have a lovely sleep, and it's close proximity to the Canary Wharf Tube station means easy access to the city!! All in all I had a wonderful stress-free stay in London and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best UK Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Andy_L680
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best UK Hiltons that I have stayed in. Everything worked very efficiently and there was a quiet air of attentiveness and welcome from all the staff. The hotel is located very close to South Quays on the DLR or you can take the Jubilee Line to Canary Wharf which is just a little further. All the amenities of Canary Wharf are on the door step with good shopping and plenty of bars and restaurants. Check in was prompt with the shortest of formalities and I was quickly in my room with a lovely view over the docklands and out to the river and City of London. The room was very well appointed with plenty of hanging and drawer space, an adequate safe, a very comfortable bed and good sized bathroom with tub and separate shower. There was the usual hospitality tray of coffee, tea and biscuits but two quite small cups – I’m not too sure why some hotels use these and not a decent sized mug! The Executive Lounge serves great snacks in the evening and a plentiful hot and cold buffet and breakfast. All too soon it was time for me to check out My only real problem was Internet access. Hilton has changed from iBahn to BT Openzone and there do seem to be a lot of teething problems with it (not just at this property) – hopefully it will all settle down shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit the O2 for a gig!”
Reviews.Author: RussellH
Reviews.Content: Fed up with arduous journeys back to Berkshire everytime we see a gig at the O2, I decided to stay over somewhere convenient after seeing Snow Patrol last weekend. This hotel is perfect for that. One stop only on the Jubilee line. Canary Wharf tube station is only 3-4 minutes walk. we drove there and used the hotels secure underground carpark, very convenient. The hotel struck me as unlike many city centre hotels. It is large and uncramped. It never seemed too busy and there were always plenty of attentive and polite staff on hand to help straightaway. The room was a very generous size especially for city centre and very well equiped. Steer clear of the mini bar though the prices are extortionate! The food at breakfast is buffet style and all tastes well catered for. I have no idea why I haven't thought to do this before. We had a fantastic time both at the O2 and the hotel with no travelling stress. I bet we were back in the hotel bar after the gig while some were still queuing to exit the O2! Will definitely do this again and this Hilton hotel is a real gem in the docklands. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Always a Good Place to Stay in London”
Reviews.Author: budgie-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions now (last time was between Christmas and New Year) and we are always given a good welcome. Located at Canary Wharf means that it is a bit out of the centre of town, but the links via the Jubilee line and the DLR are quick and efficient. As a Hilton Gold VIP member we regularly get upgraded to the Executive Floor and this is really great. The Executive lounge has a super view across London and the staff are always very helpful. Drinks, snacks and an extensive breakfast are all complimentary and certainly add to the overall positive experience. The bar and Cinnamon restaurant are modern and contemporary, rather than warm and cosy, but we have always found the service and the food to be first class and pretty good value by London standards. Overall this is one of the best Hilton hotels that we have stayed in anywhere and we will continue to use it as our 'base' when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: SunDogandCompany
Reviews.Content: I have been here a week in a room on the Executive Level. The hotel is fairly new and in nice condition. My room is not spacious but plenty of room and functional; king bed, desk, side chair, shower and tub in bathroom. Bedding and furniture in good condition. The room has been very quite. There is a nice Executive lounge on the floor. They serve a full English breakfast every morning, complementary to Hilton Gold and Diamond members. There is an afternoon tea served at 3:00 and a very nice evening happy hour starting at 6:00. The happy hour has extensive cold snacks and a couple of hot items every night. Beer is also free during happy hour. I have seen many of the other guests making a dinner out of this. There is a small but adequate fitness area; 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, 1 bike, a rower, basic machines and some free weights. Also a steam room and sauna. The hotel is just a short walk from the center of the Canary Wharf business district. Citigroup, JPMorgan, Northern Trust, State Street and many other firms are just 5 minutes away. In that same area are two underground shopping malls with everything you could want at premium prices. There are also several restaurants in the vicinity. The one thing this area lacks however is any feeling of history. Don't expect to find a cozy old pub or a stately old building. Everything is new in this glass and metal canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: IveBeenAroundNYC
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for business, stayed for two weeks. If you are like me and had to work in the canary wharf area, then this is a fine choice. Good business hotel, nice room, no complaints. Big pro is being on the executive floor which gives you free breakfast and happy hour drinks and snacks. Excellent value in that regard. I couldn't imagine staying here if I was a tourist though. Far out of central London and only the jubilee line connects you. Plus canary wharf is made up of modern glass buildings of american companies so it's like you are in silicon valley. Cons: the charges for wifi are annoying. Just lump it in to the room price or offer it for free. Also, they can't hold a reservation for more than six days, so given I was there for 13 days i had three separate hotel bills. This is dumb and a pain when you get home and submit expenses.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Canary Wharf and Business Clientele”
Reviews.Author: C_Stubing
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions, in deluxe double and executive rooms - my most recent stay being this week. The main 'selling' points for the hotel, is it's location for Canary Wharf, level of service and quality of rooms. I have always had a pleasant, hassle free, comfortable and relaxing stay at the hotel and my last visit was no difference. The services and amenities are more than adequate for a business travel and the close proximity to work is a benefit. I have also found the hotel to be quiet (which for me is a plus) and the staff more than happy to help wherever and whenever possible. The cost is high, but a premium that seems to be the norm for the CW area. Though not a major issue for the majority of clientele, a consideration if ‘you’ are paying. The hotel is still new enough to not have any (that I have seen or experienced) issues or niggling issues that do trouble other hotels. I would recommend as the business hotel in the CW area and will I am sure be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Overpriced and Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: borad
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for business. Overall the hotel was good but I was unhappy that the prices seemed to have been jacked up for the event I came to attend. Frankly I had paid less in a Four Seasons and even at the Ritz in Tokyo. Hopefully others will have better luck. Had it not been for the price my ratings could be higher but I'll try to put this aside. Location - D: My plan was to take the Metro (Piccadily Line or Heathrow Express to Paddington) but after the long flight I grabbed a couple of friends and taxi'd in. The ride was nearly 90 pounds or about $150 and an hour drive. The drive takes you through some of the better attractions (depending on the route your driver takes) but you could to see Westminster Abby, The Defense buildings, Piccadily Circus, Buckingham Palace, The London Eye or other sights along the way. Having seen these before I just wanted to get the hotel so it was a long ride. Where you end up is in the old docks area, you know, where Jack the Ripper used to hang out. Don't mis-understand me, they've done a lot to upgrade the area and work continues ahead of the Olympics, but needless to say, you're not close to the attractions of London - although there is a tube station right nearby. Check In/Staff - B: Front desk was friendly, concierge was helpful, as were the bellmen. If you do go, and you like a good steak I highly recommend the steakhouse around the corner - the bellman will tell you the name. Unfortunately I can't recall it now. Great food, good service, great bar. Restaurant/Bar: A-: Great breakfast, good atmosphere, great environment. Really well done. In the evening the folks at the bar were really great, but a bit understaffed at times. Again, the food I had here was really good. I had the scallops and the goat cheese and pear salad - YUM! Again, the environment was very accommodating. Rooms B-/C+: This is a tough one. I have a pretty limited but specific set of needs when I stay in a hotel. I don't ask for much, a good bed, a desk with internet, and a shower with adequate space and water pressure. The bed was a bit firm but decent, the shower was small but acceptable but the water pressure was sub-optimal. Most disappointing was the fact that I had to pay 14.99 pounds (~$22/day) for internet...on top of an already exhorbinate room rate. Another mark down was that the thermostats only went to 24, which would have been fine except the cleaner kept turning it down when she cleaned. Finally, when I checked in they kindly asked me what paper I'd like in the morning. I was there 4 days and never received a paper. The paper to me was a minor detail but for the price I was paying something that I would have expected. Gym C+: Small, 2 treadmills, an eliptical, a bike, some small dumbells, and a single multi-function machine. Not a lot of room to stretch. The equipment however was in good condition, just not enough of it. Overall I wouldn't stay here again for the price I paid, maybe I would for half, and only if I had business in the area. That's not a knock on the hotel itself, it's just not in an area condusive to sight seeing. Hope other find this helpful.

Reviews.Title: “everything you may expect from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: NLBanker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here one night and as the title says, my stay was everything you may expect from Hilton. I.e. a well equiped room, a good bed, nice amenities, and also overpriced breakfast and internet charges. Only if you want to be close to your Canary Wharf meeting venue, go here.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: darnfatruler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in January. My first impressions on the first day were of a hotel that overall had very high standards. The staff were very friendly, helpful and the hotel was extremely clean. The ambient temperature in every location was perfect, whether it be in the room, corridor, foyer or breakfast dining. The hotel room was very quiet the first night, the bed was a amazing, very comfortable. However, the second nights stay was spoiled by people in the room next to me. I was out in London all day from 11am to 10pm visiting galleries and museums and when I got back I just wanted to go to bed and sleep. Next door it sounded like they were having a bit of a party and enjoying themselves much at the expense of other hotel guests. They were going in and out of the room at what seemed like every 10 -15 minutes and letting the door slam shut, laughing loudly and playing music. I did give them the benefit of the doubt, thinking the noise would stop and they would go to bed. This did not happen and went on until I phoned the front desk at 2am and was told the hotel would speak to them. Thinking the noise would now end, I tried to get some sleep. Sadly, the noise continued and I phoned the desk again at 3.30am and was once again told they would check it out. The noise continued until I gave up and phoned the desk again at 4.10am and asked for a room change. I was then moved to an alternative room at 4.30am and eventually got to sleep around 5am. This was obviously not a very nice experience and it was compounded by the night desk manager's over sight at not dealing with the problem in the first instance when first reported at 2am. Needless to say, i was shattered afterwards for a good few days. In the morning when checking out I complained about what had happened to the Front of House Manager who was very apologetic. The outcome of this spoiled nights stay, is that I received a complimentary nights stay to be arranged when suitable to use in the future. This was the correct action and the only action by the Hotel and in fairness to the Hotel, they did show consummate professionalism when dealing with the incident the morning after. It is obviously with regret, that it was not dealt with properly the night before. So my stay was a mixed bag, the first day and night was amazing and I was highly impressed by this Hilton, but sadly it was spoiled by the extremely rude, selfish and ignorant behavior of the people in the room next door. I will be returning to stay at the Canary Wharf Hilton in April, as I do believe this was a one off incident and the Hotel have re-compensated me for the inconvenience caused. p.s. if you are staying at the Hotel I would recommend a visit to the London Docklands Museum in Canary Wharf. It took me a full 3 hours to look around it and the entrance is free.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: gareth_999
Reviews.Content: I finished work later than planned and instead of doing the 200mile trip home decided to stay in a hotel so turned up at the hotel at 5.45am and asked what rooms they had available, instead of attempting to charge the full whack I was offered the 9am-6pm day rate of £90 and they would check me now and give me a quiet floor not to be disturbed. A very good bit of customer service from the night staff.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arkadiy
Reviews.Content: its a decent hotel with very good service. However comparing to some other Hilton's in London such as Park Lane, its not the best. I just had to stay there for business so location closert to East London was important. They have some change with internet going on so to get access, y ou have to get a card and scratch to get pincode. Every day like this...a bit annoying, cant just get on wireless and pay online. Rooms are not as nice as Hilton park lane (more space, bigger table). Breakfast is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: LosLLanitos
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel ideally placed, however very expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Short business trip”
Reviews.Author: zapata9
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception, huge rooms, very clean. Short business trip, right in Canary Wharf, just where I needed to be. Breakfast buffet was very good, incl non stop fried eggs!. Speedy check out and the invoice arrived almost before I had got home Great service

Reviews.Title: “luxury!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaL21
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and I stayed here for new years, a total of four nights in all. the hotel are exceptional and the staff are a credit to the hotel. upon arriving in the hotel after a very early flight we were beyond tired, unfortunately the group that i had booked our stay with had messed up the dates and I was fuming. thanks to a fantastic staff the room was sorted in 5 minutes with complimentary upgrade. rooms were fab, breakfast was gorgeous. tubes are 3 min walk fromn hotel straught into city centre. we bought a tube 7day ticket for 32pound and recieved 12pound back because we only needed it for 5days! i would thoroughly recommend this hotel! Simon and Emma - Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel when visiting 02”
Reviews.Author: 186311Karen
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel ideally situated for 02, just one stop on underground. Faultless service, friendly staff. Room luxurious and spacious, previously loved staying at City,Mint hotel in Westminster, have found new favourite hotel for London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sandersandrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend, having been given the hotel through a priceline deal. The staff were very friendly upon arrival and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. The gym was impressive, although the water machine broke while I was using it (the staff did supply bottled water), and the steam room and sauna are quite small but were never busy whilst I was there. The hotel was very quiet, you'd hardly have known there was anyone else staying there. That could be a result of it being a weekend and the hotel being located in a business district. Although the hotel is closest to the South Quays DLR stop, I found it more convenient to use the Canary Wharf Jubilee line stop and walk across the foot bridge to the hotel (exit the tube and instead of going up the large escalator which is in front of you, walk through the mall to your left, exiting near the Waterstones - the hotel is across the water and slightly to the left). Given the excellent transport system in London, this hotel is very convenient for the central attractions and the Olympic site (via the Jubilee line and DLR). Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Big_Shug
Reviews.Content: A new Hilton, rooms were very well equiped, clean and comfortable. Small but well fitted out gym. Great location for Canary Wharf business. Exceptionally quiet.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect accommodation in London's East End”
Reviews.Author: alefresita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently but had been in the hotel also before. BOOKING: through Hilton's official website, taking advantage of a promo, we booked an executive room for two nights with a pre-paid, non-refundable rate. Breakfast in the restaurant and executive lounge access were included. LOCATION: once rough areas, the docklands and East London are now a super-modern, beautiful business (but not only) area. CHECK-IN: quick and pleasant. Staff were always smiling and helpful. The reception is large and, just like the restaurant, with a lot of sleek limegreen glass. ROOM: we had been in a standard room previously and had an executive room this time. Not too much difference: they are medium size, ultraclean, in beautiful warm tones, all very modern and elegant. The marble bathroom is extremely nice too. The plus with an executive room consists of getting access to the executive lounge, offering free breakfast and refreshments. Since breakfast was included in our rate, we had it in the restaurant directly. The lounge is one the best I've been to, along with those at the Hilton London Tower Bridge and the Hilton Stockholm Slussen. It's big, with a beautiful view and plenty of quality food and drinks. You can make a real meal out of it. There are computers with free internet access too. SERVICES & AMENITIES: conceived as a business hotel, the Hilton London Canary Wharf has all the possible business & meeting-related facilities but since we were there for the weekend and not for business we did not try anything of that. We did try the gym and sauna. DINING: the limegreen-glass decorated Cinnamon Restaurant & Bar is chic, beautiful and coloured. We had great Hilton breakfasts there. Selection and service are very good. TRANSPORTATION & DIRECTIONS: very well connected with central London both through the underground (Jubilee Line) and the DLR (Docklands Light Railway).The DLR is next door. We used the underground instead. Exit the gorgeous Canary Wharf underground station, turn left, go through the building and the nice footbridge. The hotel is just there. It takes no more than 5 minutes. BOTTOM LINE: We were very positively impressed by this hotel and very happy with our stay. Maybe I would not strongly recommend it to people going to London for the first time because it is a bit far from the main tourist areas. Let's put it like this: after your first visit to London, this is one of the best possible places where to stay. If you prefer the West End or being in the middle of the action (this part of the city is particularly quiet on the weekends), please note that you are very well and rapidly connected to it by underground. Of course it is an even more perfect choice for those having business in the Canary Wharf / Docklands area. TIPS: Hilton is great but usually pretty on the expensive side. Since this is mainly a business hotel in a business area, rates tend to be high on weekdays; you will usually find good and sometimes really great rates for weekend stays - take advantage of that! 10-15 minutes on the Jubilee line (or DLR) will take you to Stratford, the heart of the action of the upcoming Olympics, and to the recently opened Westfield Stratford City, the largest shopping mall in Europe. We have been there many times and can confirm it is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jason T
Reviews.Content: Accommodation was great, good location and great food. Would recommend for anyone on business in London. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend treat”
Reviews.Author: SueG56
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute and got a really good deal for Saturday night with full breakfast. I picked this hotel based on the good reviews as we have previously stayed at the Hilton Tower Bridge which was great but the location of this hotel suited us as we were going shopping at Westfield City Stratford, Greenwich and the O2. Canary Wharf is a great place to be especially at the weekend when it is handed over to the tourists. We were upgraded to a deluxe room as we had requested a high floor and we were on floor 11, one below the executive floor and it had a great view of the city. The room was large and had everything we needed. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. It was not the largest bathroom considering the size of the room which was strange but was adequate. There were a couple of missing items such as slippers to go with the bathrobes and no camomile tea but I had taken both of these with me so no need to request them, just a bit surprised but I am sure this was not typical. The room was very clean and decorated in the Hilton style which I find just a bit drab. The breakfast was very good, the food was hot and you can have omelettes made to order and cooked whilst you wait. The only thing I didn't like was the seating which in some places was a bit close to your neighbour but I could not fault the food. If you want to be in this area then this hotel is the one to go for. Thank you to Maike for honouring our requests and making us feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dramaman_10
Reviews.Content: An excellent modern hotel that is close to Tube and DLR stations to connect to all parts of London. A huge shopping complex is near by and well worth a visit Reception staff were friendly and efficient and our standard room was huge and very well appointed.Breakfast is the usual high Hilton standard buffet. Well worth using this hotel, especially on the weekend when it appears to be much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy_traveltheworld
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only 15mins by tube to central london. Lovely peaceful location. Modern hotel. Would most certainly stay here again. Great for business, couples, families, friends and solo. Great service. Concierge were great on suggesting places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koshie09
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel on a regular basis for business. It is very good and provides you with high quality accommodation though nothing of the extraordinary. Comfortable bed, clean modern bathroom. aircon and TV/kettle etc. There is nothing there that would leave you feeling spoilt or excited about coming back. Please note, that this hotel is located next to a very noisy DLR ( train service) and it is under flying paths to City airport. Never book a room on the 1,2nd or 3rd floor as you will not be able to sleep without earplugs. If you book a room on the floor 7th and above, ideally facing the canal and not DLR - you will have a much better sleep. This would not be a hotel that I would chose for leisure but it ticks most of the boxes for business travellers (if the room is high up).

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: aussie_dreams2011
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was fab just a couple of minor issues, firstly been that I booked the twin room direct throught he hilton website and paid £104, however on the day of booking I found the same room on travelrepublic.co.uk for £92. I therefore filled out a best rate gurantee form as advertised on the hilton website http://www.hilton.co.uk/HiWayWeb/appmanager/portals/customer?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pg_customer_cs_best_rates however never heard anything back even though I then emailed twice and rang the customer service line twice. Not exactly great considering i'm a hilton honors member. Also found that whilst in the hotel when I visited the health spa facilities (complimentary for hilton honors members) that there was a sign saying 'u6's may only use the swimming pool' when in fact there is no pool there is just sauna, steam room and gym. And these weren't staffed which I found a little dangerous. HOWEVER, these issues were far outweighed by the positives. I had booked the room for me and my mum as an xmas treat and we arrived at around 10.45am and did not expect to be able to check in however we were pleasantly surprised when we were informed that the room was ready and that we had been upgraded to the twin deluxe room. I believe this must have been due to me been a hilton honors blue member. The room was very spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. A nice chair to lounge in and also a desk for business use (however the lamp didn't work, didn';t report as didn't need to use the desk). The washroom was great as it had both bath and shower and nice to see a hotel that offers conditioner as well as shampoo. The room was very quiet no disturbances had a great nights sleep. Waking up to the views over the city and river was fab too (we were on the 10th floor). We checked out at arund 10.30 and the process was quick and efficient, we then left our luggage with the concierge whilst I went to a job interview and collected them a couple of hours later. Overall very pleasant service. We didn't sample hotel food due to prices and can't comment on the internet service as didn't pay for that either. (wireless should be complimentary in all hotels in this day and age). Would stay with the hotel again as the location on the DLR and underground lines with quick access to the city centre is great and the staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “good address in london”
Reviews.Author: Falctraveller
Reviews.Content: very good location we love canary wharf area quiet nice restaurant and the shopping mall just across the street walking distantance and good connected the tube stop canary wharf we wish to go there again the room are for london quiet big bathroom confortable all clean and new furnished staff friendly and efficient not bad at all

Reviews.Title: “What I expected from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: PhilandMel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my partner's birthday as part of a weekend away and a London show. Just what we expected from a Hilton and more. Rooms were spacious, modern and luxurious. Bathroom was perfect and everything from the restaurant to the corridors was perfectly appointed. The check-in was easy, even hours before the allocated time and nothing was too difficult for the staff. There was even a surprise for my partner in the room after I mentioned before arrival the trip was for a birthday treat! The location, though outside the very centre of London, is very close to DLR and Tube stations allowing easy access to everything the city has to offer. The breakfast was amazing, so much choice and excellent service. A perfect hotel, book when there's an offer on and it's even great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: mamachico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Year and my Birthday with my husband, brother and sister-in-law.I Can only say that everything is spot on, from reception to food, had a free upgrade to executive room as it was my Birthday, balloons in room and a card, lovely touch! My recommendation if you are visiting London is to book to stay here, you will not find fault with anything, breakfast...........WOW, superb,Bed so comfortable, staff so helpful. I will not book any other hotel in future should I be wanting to visit London! Thank you to the management and staff, you do an amazing job here!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoDon
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in business area of Canary Wharf. Mini-suite was good size room and the service in the executive lounge on the 14th floor was excellent with cooked breakfast and evening buffet. However, had a couple of problems which marred the positive aspects a bit. 10 minutes after getting to my room the bellman arrived to say I needed to move to the same room on a different floor. When I asked why, I was told that this room had been cleaned but not inspected. Though jet lagged, I packed up and moved to new room. Next day the electronic room key failed which happened two more times in one week. TV in bedroom of new room was non functional but this was fixed within minutes of it being reported. Wireless internet failed after 2 days. Instead of a single 6 digit access code I was given two 9 digit numbers for user name and password. This failed in 24 hours and I was then told I had to have a new one every 24 hours and one for each device (laptop, iPhone). This is hopefully not their long term solution to providing internet service. I would stay here again if convenient for business reasons but would check on status of internet services. Part of the problem may have been staying over the New Year Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: Everything was right about this hotel. Fab customer service, modern rooms and equipment. It's situation is great if you like being in the quieter part of town and it's only a 15 min journey from the West End on the Jubilee line. It's plush and modern and the breakfast - well, the best we have ever eaten (incredible choice and quality). We were treated as full paying customers which isn't always the case in other hotels! We got this as a Secret Room with breakfast incl. for a bargain price and we are desperate to return and would pay top price to do so!! In our opinion Canary Wharf is the place to stay - the Hotels have to be great and are competing for business customers which is why they are so good! We have tried other Hotels in other parts of London but prefer these modern American chains in CW becasue they do everything so well! It's also an interesting part of London because of the history of the East End/docklands and i find it quite moving remembering and imagining the history associated with the area...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Shaws_Holidays
Reviews.Content: Myself and Partner stayed here on NYE 2011, it was very convienient as we were going to the O2 for the evening. The location is fantastic and one tube stop to the O2. Hotel is very clean and spacious, very modern rooms and will deffinatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, large clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: -Bex-689
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 02 which only took a few minutes to get to, lovely modern spacious hotel and a very good price! We were on the side right by the DLR which we heard at first but we got used to it and didn't even notice it after a few hours. Had room service which was more expensive than other hiltons but average for canary wharf, was very well presented and tasted amazing! Huge bed, very comfortable and everything in the room was immaculate. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very good night”
Reviews.Author: Boldes
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the hotel pretty late - it wasn't a problem at all. got an upgrade to very nice business room. Young gentleman - trainee was very, very polite. room was clean, bathroom clean. toiletries nice:) Perfect location. Best hotel in London. Minus for offering me Financial Times that I never received.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice to do business”
Reviews.Author: EAMT
Reviews.Content: In Canary Wharf it has very good facilities and it is a very comfortable hotel. Good breakfast, rooms are spotless and with the right light to work or rest. Staff is attentive and very friendly. A good choice for those that go to London to work. I would not choose this hotel if I wanted to visit London because it is a bit far from where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: debsb75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as I was going to the O2 arena to see a show. The reception staff gave brilliant service and upgraded the room as they had accidentally put us in a smoking room. I've stayed in quite a few London hotels and 1. They don't usually speak English and 2. Aren't always friendly. This hotel however had English speaking and friendly staff. The hotel was perfect for the O2 arena and right near the tube station which is only one stop away. A tip if you are going to the O2 for a show is to eat at canary wharf before you go as the queues are very long at the O2. The hotel room was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, loved the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: BR84Kotor
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my best friends birthday. We arrived at around 10:30am and had no problem checking in. In fact we were given a free upgrade to an executive room on the 12th floor and we hadn't even mentioned it being my friends birthday! The room was very spacious and liked the option of a separate bath and shower. The hotel is around a 3 minute walk from canary wharf tube station and it is very easy to get into central London in no time. The hotel even offered to store our cupcakes from the primrose bakery in their fridges on the last day. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Excellence”
Reviews.Author: FrekwentFlajer
Reviews.Content: I have just had a perfect stay at this hotel. The guest room allocated was massive and perfectly clean. Service at the front desk and concierge couldn't have been better. Staff were genuinely concerned when I complained that the milk in my room was expired, and the duty manager sent a fruit bowl (much much more than I expected) together with an apology thus making sure this small incident did not in any way mar my otherwise perfect stay. Whether you are in London for Canary Wharf (5mins walk away) or for visiting the West End (easily reached in 20mins on the Jubilee line), I strongly recommend this excellent hotel. Follow the directions you receive by email to find it on your first day as they are much more straight forward than GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mgrt09
Reviews.Content: Just back from a very special night out at the Hilton at Canary Wharf. Booked a room and requested an upgrade if it was possible (£9) and it came good. Wow what a room and what a view!!!! Simply stunning. The room was massive and very clean (shower a little underpowered, but thats a tiny thing), huge windows out of the river and into London. It was like having your own personal view into the worlds best city. That evening we also travelled to the O2 for a concert, and this hotel is perfect for travelling to and from there. 5 min walk to the tube, and then get the riverboat back....what a way to travel. At this point I also have to commend the Hilton for appying that extra bit of magic on behalf of my future wife (You can see whats coming I bet). She made some requests that I was not aware of, such as the River view and mentioned that she was planning on using our time in the room for something. I did not even click when there was a huge heart shape laid out in rose petals on the bed....... I said "Yes" So I hope the Hilton read this review at somepoint as I am not sure how to thank them for making our engagement a truly memorable night....Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: noonie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Canary Wharf (new hotel, not to be confused with Hilton Docklands on the other side of the River Thames). Got a free upgrade to Executive floor with a spacious twin room, which was lovely. Furnishings and overall quality of the fit of the hotek is of a high standard, however the staff were the real asset. We had great smiles and genuine service from the reception, the room service staff, housekeeping and breakfast restaurant. A real pleasure to be staying here after such dreary experiences in other London hotels. Location is super for main financial area and I am sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay of 2011, excellent”
Reviews.Author: hussbrick87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with my girlfriend in February, April and December of 2011 and the hotel has been excellent everytime. It is situated about 10 minutes from Canary wharf tube station and 2 minutes from South Quays DLR station. 20 Minutes from Waterloo on the Jubilee line even less for Westminster, London Bridge to change lines. Also one stop from North Greenwich for the o2 and coming up soon it's just 15 minutes from the Olympic site. I would advise potential guests to look at maps of how to get to the hotel as you have to really exit the tube station in the correct place, (2 exits available) walk though the bottom of a building and over a small footbridge which did cause some confusion on our first stay. Rooms are large, spacious, clean and very well equipped. (hairdryer, ironing board, large tv, mini bar, safe, large beds, complimentary water daily, and more). Reception, lift and restaurant areas are all very well-lit, and clean. You will hear trains passing the building from fairly early until well after 10 but you get used to it and it didn't wake us up. Views aren't espeically fantastic from the hotel, our 2nd stay we faced scaffolding but this wouldn't put us off. Breakfast is fantastic, all the staff are friendly and helpful. We haven't had dinner there at all purely because of the obvious choices elsewhere in London but have used the room service twice which was also excellent quality and pretty speedy although very expensive. On our latest stay we went to drop our bags off at 11am to go into London knowing full well we couldn't check in until after 3pm but were told straight away that a room was ready for us which was excellent and unexpected enabling us to quickly offload without the worry of doing it later. We look forward to our next stay at this excellent hotel which I cannot recommened enough.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, Excellent Rooms and helpful Service - Great for corporate traveller as well”
Reviews.Author: sonirohan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only for one night, but surely will be staying again if I happen to come this side again for business. The location is excellent, 3 minutes walk and you are in the middle of canary wharf. Citi building is just 6 minutes on foot. Station about 5 minutes. The breakfast is very nice, enough variety to choose from and almost something for everyone. Service with a smile and very helpful staff. I did not have a BlackBerry Charger and they were happy to find one for me. Their is a hotel parking but it is charged additionally. Rooms are spacious and have most of the facilities one may require. Fitness centre is good too. All in all, a good choice if staying in Canary Wharf. My full marks to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good sound Hilton experience”
Reviews.Author: rayw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend, primarily to go to the tennis at the O2. The room was comfortable, clean and the bed gave a good night sleep. The hotel is convenitly close to Jubilee line and DLR. Sraff were pleasant and helpful and it was particularly useful to be able to leave our bags, after checkout, so that we could spend the day in london unencumbered. One small qibble abut breakfast, which overall was excellent, but the quality of the sausages was poor - low meat content and rather thick skins. We had a special weekend deal whch was good value. We asked the price of an extra night and it was about £230 to stay on Sunday. I guess this is because its in the heart of the business district, but at that rate I would (and did) go elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would return here, good for the O2”
Reviews.Author: Goldielookinghair
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed here for 2 nights. Staff were really friendly and nothing too much trouble - changing our bed from twins to double, finding some creme de menthe (no, I don't know why she wanted it either!) for one of my friends. Really good breakfast choices lots of fruit, yoghurts, cereals, breads, full English, porridge etc., tho the cheese and meat a bit dried out on the Monday morning. We came for the tennis at the O2 and would definitely go back as it was one stop from the venue and only 5 mins walk to the tube (Canary Wharf). Rooms are a decent size, shower powerful and has all the usual facilities you would expect at a Hilton. and by booking really early we got a great deal on the price. Oh and yes it was very quiet so we got a great 2 night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty damn good - especially of you're going to the o2”
Reviews.Author: John_Kelly123
Reviews.Content: Good-sized room, very comforftable beds. Only had a burger on the food front but was very good. Breakfast was up to the usual Hilton high standard. Only 10mins walk from Canary Wharf tube, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “'A Great Stay'”
Reviews.Author: MARK K
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for one night - This was our second time staying at this hotel, and were once again not disspointed!!. Staff were friendly and polite. We were also upgraded to a delux room on the 10th floor...VERY NICE!!. Can't reccomend this hotel enough...We look forward to returning soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - hope to come back soon”
Reviews.Author: pldmmck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Saturday night in March. First the location. Although it's not in a central tourist area, it has the advantage of quieter and cleaner surroundings. Besides, it's only about twenty minutes by tube into the heart of theatreland or better still you can take the riverbus service and stop off at The Globe theatre, The Tate Modern, the Festival Hall or The London Eye (about 30 minutes). There is also a super cafe and restaurant just a few yards down the road from the hotel (as you arrive from the tube station) with a wide choice of meals (many vegetarian) at extremely reasonable prices. The hotel itself met all our expectations based on other favourable reviews here: a large and comfortable room, no noise at night, excellent breakfasts and friendly. efficient service. We went to a show at the Royal Albert Hall on the Sunday afternoon and were able to leave our luggage at Reception until the early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: reded46
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three night over the weekend, although the hotel was very busy the service was always excellent. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at reception, in the restaurant and room service. The breakfast was good, and the rooms clean. The location is outside the tourist area but with the underground only 5 minutes walk away travel into the centre of London was easy and fast. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, spacious, well equipped and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FrednGinger
Reviews.Content: Our first vist to Canary Wharf. The Hilton is a super place to stay with fast access into the city via the Jubilee line or DLR and interesting waterside to explore on foot. Shopping Mall and multiple eating venues within walking distance if that is your scene. Hotel Staff were pleasant and welcoming. The rooms very comfortable and spotless. View from room not inspiring but so what with big flat screen TV for relaxing in-bed viewing and sound in the bathroom. Breakfast was really excellent. Didn't get chance to try dinner. Well done Hilton Canary Wharf! We will be back...

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely birthday week-end”
Reviews.Author: sandybrandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a coach week-end to celebrate my 60th birthday. The location was fantastic, within easy walking of the main centre of Canary Wharf, lots and lots of shops and numerous stations. Our room (Room 219) was large, clean and well equipped. The view was over a building being built, but no work being done as it was Saturday/Sunday, but if you are in the front you have the DLR running nearly level with your window! The breakfast was one of the best we have eaten in all our hotel staying years! Everything you have ever wanted was there, very good quality and so tasty. Found the in-house restaurant very expensive but there is no shortage of places to eat, just past South Quay station found a lovely Italian restaurant.......unbelieveable! Hoping to stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AQ4
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying in the Hilton earlier this month as I was attending the spirit of fire awards with my friend. Every part of this hotel is simply outstanding.Lovely,friendly staff.Our room was on the 12th floor,the views were spectacular!!Also had access to the executive lounge situated on the 14th floor.The cleanliness throughout this hotel is first class.Absolutely loved it :-)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: miekesAntwerp
Reviews.Content: what to say? a great hotel, great staff, very friendly and efficient, biggest room I've ever seen in London very very good breakfast. The weekend we stayed the DLR wasn't running due to engineering works, but this was no problem at all, as the underground is only a 5 minutes walk away. If at all possible we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done and plenty of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Everything the other reviews say is true. Stayed for a business trip. Great everything. Breakfast service was wonderful and friendly every time. hope to be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kenco66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently treated ourselves and upgraded our two night stay to include the executive lounge. The hotel was clean, the location suited our purposes and the staff were both friendly and helpful. The use of the executive lounge was extra, but worth that additional cost, a quite comfortable area with available beverages, afternoon high tea and hot snacks served with the evening alcoholic liquid refreshments. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roncr7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in Dec 2010. The room was very big, clean and nice. The room service was a bit pricey and the food wasn't exactly great, on top of that I think they charged me 20% service charge for it, so if you are going to order room service don't have too much expectation on value for money. Also the phone signal strength is quite poor in the room, you'd only get some poor reception right next to the window. Other than the room service and mobile phone signal, I do think it is a very nice property, but probably isn't worth anywhere near £200 a night

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hilton Canary Wharf - and the hotel is exactly what you would expect from this chain. It was clean, well decorated, comfortable and the staff were pleasant and helpful. I arrived early and the front desk were helpful and allowed me to check in early as I had a meeting in the city in the early afternoon. Only down side was seeing Gordon Brown in the lobby after breakfast - not a good start to my day, but not the hotels fault.:-) Would definatley recommend this hotel - and will staying again when in Canary Wharf on business.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: janey5600
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hilton's throughout the world and several in London. This is a really good one! The hotel is very modern, clean and spacious. Many London hotels are cramped, dirty and overpriced, this Hilton is the exact opposite. We stayed in a junior suite and it was a lovely large room with a super kingsize bed and separated lounge area. Only one minor gripe. The kettle had to be put onto the floor as the lead would not reach the power socket. I don't know how safe this is??? The bathroom consisted of a separate shower and bath and plenty of bath products and towels for several days. The reception staff were very fast and courteous as were the bar and breakfast staff. They had obviously had a good trainer as all were very competant in their roles. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the tube station but its not a boring one as you have to walk through a small shopping mall to get to it and then over a nice bridge. I would definately stay at this Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer quality”
Reviews.Author: Sherlock H
Reviews.Content: The room was huge as was the bathroom. Stylish and comfortable. Friendly reception staff. £160 for a double room on a Friday night, not bad, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, modern hotel - good value for London”
Reviews.Author: Nadine B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenage daughter at the end of October and we can concur with the other reviews that this is an excellent place tp stay in London. Yes, it is not in the centre of town but it is a 5 minute walk from the Jubilee line (forget DLR) and a 15 minute train ride to Westminster. The rooms are very spacious and nicely designed, and the breakfast - included in our price - was excellent. I also tried the gym which was well equipped and open 24 hours a day. Service was also very efficient and friendly - overall one gets the feeling this is a well-managed hotel. Just one remark for the manager (who seems to read these reviews) : the bed was not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel - hard ridge down the middle, leaving the choice of balancing on the high ground or sleeping on the slope. Sort that out and the hotel is wortg 5 stars ...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for those with business in Canary Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Equities4me
Reviews.Content: When I stay at Canary Wharf, I really don't feel like I'm in London. That's a bad thing. But, staying near where I have business meetings beats fighting the crowds on the Jubilee Line each morning. Of the hotels on the Wharf, this Hilton is probably one of the best choices. It is, however, a fairly boring business hotel without much character. But, it's clean; the rooms are good sized; and, for residents, the bar stays open late. However, the bar would benefit from a new manager. When I was there, they had let all but one draft beer variety run out. I guess changing the keg is too much work. And, while the shelves behind the bar are stocked with spirits, the "bartender" told me she doesn't mix drinks. Well, if you're out of beer and can't mix a drink, a bar's variety soon becomes sadly limited. It wasn't like this a year ago. I suspect someone new is in charge.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton with terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: trishCork
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here instead of our usual London Hotel, Marriott West India Quay and boy are we glad we did. Arrived early, not really expecting to be allowed to check in. We were greeted by a smiling receptionist who warmly welcomed us to the Hilton Canary Wharf. (Other hotels please take note. A warm welcome sets the tone for the customers stay.) Our room on the 7th floor was ready. A lovely comfortable room. Two televisions, huge comfortable bed and a separate living area. The area around the hotel is very pleasant. We found the tube at Canary Wharf (Jubilee line) a more convenient way to travel although Canary Wharf DLR is handy too. Breakfast in the hotel was very good, plenty of choice and never too crowded. But by far the thing about the Hilton Canary Wharf that impressed us the most was the staff. From the receptionists at check in and check out,both genuinely friendly and helpful, offering us hints and tips on travel etc; to the waiting staff in the dining areas. Working with the public myself I know how important it is to go that little bit extra to ensure your customer is happy. The staff at this hotel surpassed themselves in this regard. In particular the customer relations manager, Maria Lopez, went out of her way to make our stay a memorable one. She is a credit to the Hilton Name. We are already planning our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rowie1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice now, both times for quite long periods. The rooms are large by London standards, bathrooms nicely fitted out, aircon is good, bed pretty hard but this seems common in London. The rooms though, are extremely quiet and one rarely hears any noise. This is a business hotel, with good proximity to the towers of Canary Wharf by way of the pedestrian footbridge over a nearby canal. Executive lounge is large and comfortable. Breakfast is well catered for in the Lounge, with a selection of cold and hot foods. Canapes and a great selection of beverages are served in the Lounge every evening. Restaurant food is very nice, however the service was poor. On one dinner occasion, there were 4 restaurant staff on (3 men plus one woman), and she literally ran herself ragged looking after ALL of the tables. The three male staff variously stood at the bar and desk chatting for the course of my whole meal. I raised this with the female team member, and she suggested it was always the way. She begged me not to mention it, as was extremely fearful of getting into trouble. Something not quite right with the culture to my mind... Check in was ok, however the concierge and bell boy studiously ignore arriving guests - I have arrived many times by taxi and never once helped with bags. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the very comfortable rooms and good Executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “THEATRE TRIP”
Reviews.Author: BABYNINA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using tesco club card rewards which meant two nights stay,we arrived on friday 21st of oct and checked out on sun 23rd.We found the hotel faultless and the location is great.we used the underground which is on the doorstep and we used the thames river taxi which is a ten minute walk to north quay.breakfast was all you could ever want it to be and the staff are very good in all areas of the hotel.The only negative and this is a warning to anyone using tesco vouchers is that on arrival we handed in our voucher that covered our stay but they asked for a swipe of a debit card which we allowed,the day after checkout(today monday 24th)we checked our bank account and the hotel had taken out the full amount for our stay £621 so they got paid twice,they agreed it was there mistake and sent the money back to visa but it still remains unavailable in our bank untill tomorrow.very naughty,be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for London and large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BristolSunshine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner at the beginning of October for one night at the weekend. It is in a great location, very close to the tube and the Millennium Dome. The foyer is spotlessly clean and welcoming. We were upgraded to a Queen deluxe room which had a huge bathroom! Toiletries are of a very good quality by Crabtree & Evelyn. We also had complimentary water and coffee/tea making facilities/dressing gown robes. The bed was extremely comfy and the air-conditioning good. The room also had very good sound-proofing! The only disappointment was no wireless internet in the room which I would expect from a business hotel. I hope they will be introducing this soon. I would definitely stay here again when visiting London due to the lovely rooms and good proximity to central London via the Jubilee Line.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lorrymac
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was very close to the venue of a friends wedding. The hotel is very stylish as you would expect but there was great attention to detail too. Beautiful cushions on the bed and chairs and lovely pictures. The furniture and decor was all in good condition unlike another Hilton I visited. The bed was very comfortable.The room had a full length mirror which was excellent. We managed to get a good deal for one night with breakfast but I was pleased to see that we also got free bottled water in the room. I know sad, but you usually dont even get that. The breakfast was a buffet and was hot and a good selection. All staff were welcoming, freindly and informative. The hotel was in an excellent location for the shopping mall, the wharf & bars and the floral garden.The downside - no room to park at the hotel so had to park at the next hotel with more expensive fees. The lighting in the room was mood lighting, very relaxing but no good when Im putting on make up to go to a wedding. The area around the sink was small and full and had a double towel rail above leaving no space for own toiletries etc whilst the wall near the toilet was empty. The whole wall was curtained whilst the window was only a third of the wall-strange? I prefer big windows. Overall though I enjoyed my one night stay and would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela851
Reviews.Content: We had a three night weekend stay at this fabulous hotel. I aked for a room with a good view as it was a special trip for my birthday. Oh my goodness,the view was outstanding. We were on 11th floor overlooking the river and city skyline. The hotel is super clean, modern and friendly. The room was a good size and very clean. I have often read negative reviews about the breakfast but I can highly recommend the breakfasts here. Being a catering manager I know how difficult it is to keep breakfast buffet food hot and at the same time at a high standard, I was impressed every morning. The hotel is very close to Canaty Wharf Tube Stattion and the DLR. I will never stay in central London again, It is a safe area and I can't wait to return to both Canary Wharf and the London Hilton Canary Wharf. Well done to all staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JerryStarnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a two night weekend break and so the price we paid was cheaper than the normal business rate. The only negative was the fact that there was no wifi available in the room, instead there was a charge of £15.00 for cable connection. In a hotel of this quality and standard it is surprising. Apart from this everything else was excellent. The staff were friendly and polite, the hotel was clean and room fine. We only ate breakfast in the hotel which was excellent. There was plenty of choice and well managed. Finally, the location of the hotel is great for either exploring the local area or travelling into London. There are excellent and frequent transport links into the City. Enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: BenALittleHoughton
Reviews.Content: I stay here all the time with business and love it, as a Diamond member I normally get upgraded and always get lounge access which is on the 14th floor and the has the most amazing views across London, rooms are Hilton standard spec which is very good and shows why they are ahead of the others in this market. Great Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: giggs46
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for us after a concert at the O2 arena. Ideal location when visiting the O2 as it is one stop on the tube. When my boyfriend booked the hotel, he was given the choice to upgrade to a suite if one avaliable for a reduced price, as it was for one of my bday presents he jumped at the chance. So glad he did. When we arrived, they advised we had been upgraded to the suite and this gave us use of the executive lounge. Our room wasnt ready when we arrived so they told us we could go up the lounge to wait. The executive lounge was brilliant (tea, coffee, soft drinks ie coke, red bull, fruit juice) all complimentary. Plus they had cookies laid out (warm when they first put them out, yummy), cheese straw type things and nuts. Then mid afternoon from 3 they also put a selection of sandwiches out, cakes, scones! So good and all free.You also got access to internet if you wanted it, i think this was also free but we didnt use it so not sure. Im guessing if you stay in a suite then this gives you use of the executive lounge. Views from there are so lovely as well, looking over the quay. Our suite was ready from about 3, we were on the 12th floor and had the same view of the lounge - perfect for us. Massive windows in the room to take it all in. We loved the suite, bed was huge and so comfy, 2 flat screen tv's, nice sofa area. Bathroom good size with bath and seperate shower, with lots of complimentary body moisturiser, mouth wash etc. Breakfast was included, we got the choice to have it in the main restuarant or in the executive lounge, we chose the main restaurant as they did cooked breakfast. It was buffet but lots of choice and very yummy. Check out was at 12, but we spoke to them about watching a football match in the lounge and they said this was fine they would extend our checkout until 3. Brilliant. However the channel we wanted to watch wasnt working in the lounge or our room but said we could watch in the main bar on ground floor. They even gave us complimentary drinks as we couldnt watch in the lounge. Very very good. Great service from all staff, we loved our stay and really hope we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for weekend deals”
Reviews.Author: freakytsz
Reviews.Content: very clean, excellent breakfy, professional and very friendly staff - very spacious room, renovation seems very new and well done. Weekend deals can be very tempting - would be on top of my list for london weekends.

Reviews.Title: “A excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danrelv
Reviews.Content: Stay in the Hilton Canary Wharf over a weekend and I could find fault at all. Room was fantastic, spacious and clean as was the bathroom and view from the room was great (we were on the 12th floor). TV in the room showing a multitude of channels and the bed was big and comfy. Hotel staff were efficient, very friendly and helpful and breakfast in the morning was ample. Plenty to choose from, fresh, filling and everything was clean and presented excellently. Hotel is a good 10 minutes DLR ride away(South Quay) from Bank (main interchange) and then obviously time onwards from there, so this isnt a central hotel but its no fuss on the tube so it doesnt matter at all. The location of the hotel is great and it feel like a nice safe area. There are ATM's near by, a small tesco's for any late night snacks and some great restaurants along the water front. It did look as though some of the hotel rooms might have been over looking the DLR track but as I didnt stay in a room I cant comment on view or noise. Overall a great hotel and I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulaLittleborough
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from the tube at Canary Wharf. The hotel is nice and trendy and the rooms are lovely with tea/coffee biscuits etc. Loads of choice for breakfast but the hot food can be a bit rubbery as it is all cooked at once and then left being warmed up. Other than that all was well. There are a few bars/restaurants close by. I got a great deal on Expedia which beat the hotel web site prices.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if you have business at Canary Wharf”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Modern, pleasant hotel, also steps from the tube if you need to travel to more central locations. Rooms are of decent size, at least for London. Avoid cabs arranged by the concierge, they tend not to have meters and the drivers have questionable knowledge of the city. You end up negotiating the fare while they are on the phone to the dispatcher asking for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: EVolFan
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by this hotel and the location.
