This was the first time in my many travels to London that I have stayed in the Canary Wharf area and I was surprised how scenic, clean and modern this area is. The hotel is a short walk across a pedestrian bridge across a boy off the Thames from the Canary Wharf tube station, which is on the Jubilee Line, giving you quick access to many loactions in Central London. You can see the O2 arena from the hotel and looks to be convenient to many of the 2012 Olympic Sites. The hotel is modern and well appointed and my room was nicely decorated with a large flat panel television and a marble/granite bathroon with a separate tub and shower. My king sized bed was comfortable and the room was spacious with chair and ottoman in a seating area as well as a desk and desk chair. The only negative I would mention is that there is only wired internet access in the room, no wireless (they said it was coming soon), meaning that I had to go to the executive lounge to access the wireless there. The staff was efficient and friendly, from the front desk staff, the executive lounge staff, to the housekeeping staff, who visited my room in the morning while I was at breakfast, and in the evening for a turndown service, which was nice to return to after a long day of touring. I've stayed in many luxury hotels in London in the Hyde Park area and I think this hotel compares very favorably, especially for the price. I chuckled at the previous reviewer who mentioned that the hotel had 'no soul' If you're looking for an old hotel with 'character', which in Europe usually means a small room with questionable plumbing, I guess this hotel is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Phillip J
Reviews.Content: Just like too thanks the amazing staff on the front desk...especially the girl trainning....she was very helpful and friendly..sorted out any issues with our room....(not that there was really anything wrong) sorry I cant remember her name...the rooms were amazing too very big and very clean...alot of choice for breakfast...they really made my friends birthday very special with balloons.....will be going to this hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, fantastic room, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cat111
Reviews.Content: I have already stayed here once with work...me and my husband then stayed again for our wedding anniversary on 1st July and had a Junior Suite. We had been planning the trip to London for a year. The hotel was lovely and the staff were great...there were chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us in the room and balloons when we arrived which was lovely. However about two months before our trip I rang and got put through to the concierge service as I wanted to organise for a bottle of Laurent Perrier Rose champagne to arrive at our room at 7.00pm to surprise my husband whilst we were getting ready. Anyway I was waiting and waiting...of course I couldnt phone down to ask where it was as that would ruin the surprise...7.45pm came and eventually I had no choice but to tell my husband as I didnt know whether it would eventually turn up or not and we had a table booked at Murano for dinner at 9pm. We went and asked at the excecutive lounge and they asked us to wait whilst they found out what happened. Again we were kept waiting until 8.30 and then were told to go back in our room where it was all waiting for us along with some cakes to say sorry. However we ended up being late for the restuarant! Apart from that I couldnt fault the hotel...the room was huge with a fantastic view. The executive lounge was fantastic as was breakfast. We are coming back again this Friday 30th sept for my birthday and staying in a junior suite again which is excellent value for money. I feel like we are regulars now!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, excellent Location, Staff couldn't be more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here earlier this year and we found the hotel to very clean, modern and in an excellent location. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable, the food was very good and the room service was impeccable. We are flying over from Sweden next weekend with our 2 teenage boys to see a show at the o2 and we thought we would treat ourselves with another stay at this Hilton, we've made a few special requests like early check in and an adjoining room to our suite and the staff have been absolutley amazing, particularly Maike Tiedemann (the Assistant Front of House Manager), he has replied to our emails within hours and been very helpful. If you want to stay in this part of London then this is without doubt the best place we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “lovely modern hotel spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: LesleyWorcs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in September celebrating our wedding anniversary. The room and bathroom very clean and spacious although the bed could have been more comfortable. Well located for tube, DLR or river boats. We got a good weekend deal which included breakfast which was up to the usual high standard for Hilton hotels. We used the clipper boat service to visit the annual Thames Festival, well worth a visit included a wonderful carnival and fireworks. There is also a very interesting musuem at Canary Wharf shows the history of London, by the way free to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for stay”
Reviews.Author: davewelly
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel thats very handy for the DLR to allow you access to the tube and London, also only two stops from Greenwich for a great night out. Watch the bar prices though much too expensive. The breakfast is great and later in the day Hilton Burgers rule supreme. The rooms are comfortable as you would expect from an Hilton. Also allows easy access to the shopping at Cannary Warf. A good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great, wouldn't like to be paying though”
Reviews.Author: GLSA
Reviews.Content: A Great Hilton, couldn't be handier right on the doorstep of Canary Wharf, super rooms and restaurant. Bar food very high standard too for a meal later on. No complaints about the rooms at all. Having said all that this was a pricey London hotel, I was staying on a business rate and glad i was not paying myself. Nice confirtable business stay.

Reviews.Title: “a room without a view!”
Reviews.Author: vemula
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a weekend at the hilton. hotel was nice, our room was on the 10th floor with a view of a quad, scaffolding and apartments! even though id emailed the hotel before going to ask for a room with a view as the weekend away was for my birthday we got the height just not the view! all the hotel facilities are modern and clean. the buffet breakfast was very tasty. the waiting staff very attentive and pleasant. only criticism for this hotel would be the wifi. £15 for 24 hours seems alot to pay when we paid £160 for our room. is it too much to ask for free wifi?! would return to canary wharf again, the area is lovely. good shops and bars near the hotel. on the whole hotel was good would probably only stay there again if i could get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice service”
Reviews.Author: mary0128
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was kind of convenient to get to the exhibition center. It had good train connections to any place of interest within London. The rooms are nice and new, clean and very comfortable. The view is also nice, because it is located in a new office area and directly at a canal. Checking in took quite a lot of time because the staff was not very fast. The same happened at check out. The waiting line at the front desk grew longer and longer in the mornings and I had the feeling that the staff was not capable of handling all of these people and demands. The breakfast area was nice, but the service was also not very good. There were a lot of people, but they seemed to ignore the guests and the hot beverages were only served after quite a lot of time after ordering them. The executive lounge was nice and quiet. The staff was friendly and it was a good alternative to sitting in the main restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and relaxing stay in Canary Warf”
Reviews.Author: GeTrn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week and were given an upgraded room. Location is great, even though out of city centre, and Canary Warf tube station is a 5 min. walk away (about 20 min. ride to center). It is also close to the new Olympic area, the O2, and Greenwich. I personally like the area with the docks and the river, some nice pubs and restaurants, you can enjoy walking or jogging nearby, there are not too many tourist and it is very quiet at night. Staff are very nice and friendly , housekeeping is great, breakfast buffet and the bar / restaurant service are both excellent. The room was quite spaciuos and with a great view of the river and the city, however the mattres wasn't as comfortable as i could expect and bathroom supplies were a little bit limited (anyway our fault, since we were quite busy and didn't want to bother calling housekeeping). We got express check out delivered in the room the day of departure. Overall if you do not need to be in the center that is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: kevinam
Reviews.Content: I travel to London frequently and have stayed here about ten times in the past few years. I've always had a perfect stay: a room is always ready for me, Diamond member benefits are delivered consistently, staff are friendly, housekeeping always makes up the room beautifully (including evening turn down service), lounge provides excellent array of choices, breakfast buffet downstairs is excellent, beds are comfortable, no housekeeping carts rolling down the hallways so its always fairly quiet, etc., etc. I just can't say these things about almost any other hotel in London (many of which I have to stay at more frequently, unfortunately, than the Hilton Canary Wharf).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here using our Hilton points. We are diamond members so we were given an upgraded room and use of the executive lounge for free. Great executive lounge with beautiful views. Our hotel room was spacious and also had great views. The hotel is not in the town center but close to a tube station. I actually enjoyed staying a little out of the touristy area because we got to see more locals out and about. Canary Wharf still has lots of restaurants and pubs if you want to stay close to the hotel at night but not have to just hang out in the hotel bar (although the bar is nice). Hotel staff was excellent. I would not recommend staying here if you are trying to hit as many sights as possible with only a couple of days in London. However, I would stay here is you are staying for a few days and it will give you a chance to see more parts of London (also, it's close to the new Olympic area). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jippy
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We'd never stayed in this area before and weren't sure what to expect, but the hotel was really lovely, very contemporary with good sized rooms and a good breakfast selection. Staff were very friendly and efficient, just the job.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: liana k
Reviews.Content: I wish we could have stayed there longer than one night, but this gives us a reason to go back. We went to London to celebrate our engagement and my friends birthday. On arrival we were greeted with a news that we have been upgraded to junior suite because of our celebration, the room and bed was decorated with rose petals. Our room was beautiful and big. And our friend got a room upgrade and birthday balloons-which I think is a great gesture. All staff we met were very friendly and helpful. Hotel it self is modern and sleek, defiantly business rather than leisure hotel . We loved the area where the hotel is located it is very modern and feels like you are in New York rater than London, but here you can find plenty of things to do and bars for everyones taste. Plus the London City center id few tube stops away. We went for dinner in the restaurant, and again it did not disappoint us, service was great and food even better and for a reasonable price. We are definitely going back there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with big room , but a tad bit away from the city”
Reviews.Author: colin_morrissey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend, we got a room on the 12th floor (1201) which had a very nice view and the rooms were spacy and modern. Breakfast was great, with lots of tasty pastries , hot food and fruits The only minus was the distance from the city , took about 30 mins or so to get into central london, on that basis , i would stay closer to city next time, but good value all the same for what we paid (250 euros )

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in London”
Reviews.Author: magidero
Reviews.Content: We have been to London about five times in the last year and have stayed at the Hilton London Canary Wharf every time. Quite simply I don't think any other hotel could live up to it. We usually stay in a suite with Executive Lounge access and right from the moment we check in until the moment we leave nothing is too much trouble. All staff are polite, friendly and will go out of their way to help you if they can. It was nice to see this weekend that there are now larger televisions in the room which makes a big difference. Only criticism is that it is advertised that Executive Rooms have a DVD player and we had brought a DVD to play this weekend. Unfortunately there was not a DVD player and after mentioning this to staff, all that was available was a portable DVD player which needed to remain plugged in! Given the size of the room and the location of the plug sockets it was not a very comfortable way of watching! This hotel is totally worth the added time of a short journey into the centre!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in London”
Reviews.Author: SheenaHull
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter stayed at this hotel for two nights, we absolutely loved it. The room was really big and had everything you could ask for - hairdryer, iron and ironing board, fully stocked fridge, tea and coffee, bathrobes and slippers, flat screen tv. I asked for a room with a river view and it really was fantastic looking over the Thames and the London skyline, especially at night. The beds were wonderfully comfortable and the bathroom was superb. The breakfast could not be faulted with anything you could want, from full English to continental, the waiting staff were all friendly and attentive. We would definately stay at this hotel again and the only downside was we didnt stay for longer. Breakf

Reviews.Title: “Just does not do it for me”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: Canary Wharf is pretty slim on choice when it comes to hotels. Theres the Brittania (something out the 80s), The Marriott (can't comment as i have not stayed there) and the Hilton (no soul). The hilton is basically a business hotel and has all that is required without adding any atmosphere. It just does not do it for and i visibly deflate every time i go in there, and its really expensive..Like i said it does not do it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're doing business in the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: SSfamily
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and very run hotel. They have it down to a science. I would rather stay in the city but when in the Wharf it is great. Great breakfast, Large comfortable rooms and baths. Great business traveler hotel with all the services and consistency tha comes with a hilton

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay in Canary Wharf”
Reviews.Author: DottoressadiExeter
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton Canary Wharf as part of birthday celebrations in July and found the staff to be as welcoming and friendly as ever. Staying in a junior suite we thought the views out over the rest of the city were lovely and were very impressed by the large and luxurious bathroom. The staff, noticing it was a birthday celebration, surprised us once again by leaving some lovely birthday cake, balloons and a card in the room whilst we had gone out for lunch. It added a wonderful touch to our stay, so thank you very much! The hotel was wonderfully clean and check in was very easy. The executive lounge was also a lovely place to sit and relax with a drink whilst watching the construction of the new Shard building in the distance. Having stayed in a number of London hotels over the years the Hilton Canary Wharf is by far my favourite, being a reasonable price when booked in advance and with great transport links to the city centre. We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Radioface
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on our 2nd wedding anniversary. We've stayed in Docklands before and opted to do the same again as it's a welcome break from the intensity of the city centre, yet it's only a stone's throw away. Getting to the Hilton is so easy, just use the DLR, hop off at South Quay (10 min trip from Bank) and the hotel is right in front of you. The hotel itself has a very modern feel and is decorated to a high standard. The reception area is pleasant and we didn't have to wait at all to check-in. I was amazed at the size of the room, it was huge! I think this is another benefit of staying away from the city centre, in general the hotel rooms are much larger. This one had a seating area and desk and there was still plenty of space. We had a south facing room which looked directly at and was level with the train tracks which concerned me at first, however the insulation was so good that you couldn't hear a thing. I should also mention that the room was air-conditioned, had good tea and coffee facilities and had a large bathroom with quality toiletries provided. We didn't use the restaurant here as we preferred to venture into the city and find somewhere to eat. There aren't many options on for eating in the immediate area other than a small cafe down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: HappyNoel
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days there last weekend as part of our second wedding anniversary - excellent little spot, very helpful staff and perfect room. The hotels in the docklands can often be great value for weekenders - my theory is it's because business people who would use these hotels monday to friday are away at the weekend. Either way the Jubilee line nearby means central london is never far away. I've stayed in fleapits in central london for the same price as this wonderful 4 star hotel. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveller66
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time we stayed at this hotel and it won't be the last. It is a great feeling knowing that after a busy day you will sleep in a calm, comfortable place, far from all the city fuzz. Comfortable, clean, sound-proofed rooms and excellent staff, nothing more to say!

Reviews.Title: “It delivers your expectations”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: When you book into a Hilton, you get some expectations. This Hilton delivers them. Everything was superb. I really don't need to write that the room was clean, bed was cozy, breakfast was brilliant and service was good. Well, I just did. There isn't much to do in Canary Wharf, but there is a huge shopping center right across the water. It takes like three minutes to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless, looking forward to another stay”
Reviews.Author: sadlincs
Reviews.Content: Thank you all at the Hilton for making our short break together such a happy one. My self and my husband stay in many hotels (including various Hiltons through out the UK.) and b&b's and this one has to be the best hands down. Your staff are exemplary and a credit to you. Our room was a good size, spotlessly clean, with lovely decor. The breakfasts here are second to none, with so much to choose from, and the staff are so friendly and attentive, as are all the staff. We like to try out new hotels when we travel, but we will definitely be back in September for our wedding anniversary as we can be assured of a wonderful stay. x

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 separate weekends now. Weekend rates especially attractive. Greeted pleasantly on arrival and have been upgraded as an HHonors member Loved the room. Excellent facilities and nice views. Suited us especially as parking on site is available. Lots of shops and restaurants and bars nearby and yet reasonably quick access in to town on the Jubilee line. The breakfasts are in my opinion better than Hilton average. I guess it will be a prime spot for the location for the upcoming Olympics!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel for business people”
Reviews.Author: LisaMoscow_Russia
Reviews.Content: I stayed once in this fancy hotel being on business travel. Canary Wharf offices 5 min walk. But 30 min travel to central London. Very fancy decoration. Wonderful view on London city, good breakfast and all comfort included. Room very spacy and clean. The only minus - you only bread with AC air, no possibility to open the window. Also visited a sport/fitness center which is of best quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new with easy access to London sights”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGirlOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I am a Hilton gold member and the Hilton is sometimes my happy place. At the end of every long, tiring and dirty camping, sailing, hiking, biking, middle-of-no-where touristing vacation I am always happy to arrive at a nice new Hilton in a great city like London. This Hilton is both nice and new. Our rooms and beds were very comfortable, linens were soft, and we had plenty of hot water. The full English breakfast buffet was very good, though I may have thought it a bit overpriced if it wasn't provided to me for no charge. Staff was very friendly, maid service was fantastic, and the concierge had great ideas for fun things to do at the last minute. I also used and really appreciated the nice work-out facility which included a sauna and steam room. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and I recommend the nearby Mexican restaurant to all American tourists who have been in England long enough to be done with Pub and Indian food. Just ask the concierge how to get there; he’ll give you a map. The entrance to the tube is also within easy walking distance as is a Taxi cab line. The only thing keeping this from being a perfect stay is that the fee for WIFI at this hotel was pretty steep. Hilton’s usually offer free internet to frequent guests but in this case the provided in room internet was wired, which doesn’t work for my portable device. The only WIFI available was in the lobby for £10 per day. The business center also charged a pretty steep price for internet service on their computers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Close To Canary Wharf”
Reviews.Author: chris_green100
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, clean and very good service. Only 2 -3 minutes walk from DLR and 5 - 10 mins walk from Canary Wharf Juberlee Line station. Clean surroundings for places to walk. Staff extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tanialh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Canary Wharf Tube Station and from walking through the revolving doors, into this modern hotel, we received a warm welcome from reception. We weren't asked if we required a wake-up call or a morning newspaper; nor were we told where to take breakfast, but this is minor stuff. I'm a H Honors member and I'd noted on my reservation that it was my birthday, but it was still a surprise to be upgraded to an Executive room! Our room (1316) was on the 13th floor with glimpses of the Thames and interesting views across London. The room was spacious and very clean. When we arrived back to our room, after an afternoon shopping, we found balloons and 2 plump slices of chocolate cake, waiting for us. It was a lovely surprise (considering we'd already had a room upgrade) and lovely touch. Breakfast had a fantastic range of choices and was delicious. Hot chocolate isn't readily available, but ask for it, it's well worth it! I wouldn't hesistate to recommend this hotel - location, staff, decor, and food. Great!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Roxie033
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel property that we stayed at in Europe. When we arrived, we found out that our hotel room had been upgraded. The view (ask for a room overlooking the river) was wonderful. The service was amazing. After touring London, we did not find a restaurant opened. When we went back to the hotel, we were famished. We asked if the restaurant was open, and the reply was yes. We actually found out the restaurant was closing, but they had made an exception for us!

Reviews.Title: “Will always love hiltons”
Reviews.Author: ambieoo7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to watch a concert at the o2. Rooms are clean and very modern as always, and the breakfast speaks for itself!!! If you have never had a Hilton breakfast then you should it's the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, faultless - we were really spoilt and made to feel special”
Reviews.Author: DowningUk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the previous reviews for a 40th birthday celebration in London for four ladies. All the staff from front desk, concierge, the maid service and breakfast staff deserve a pat on the back for providing such good service – the staff training provided is obviously faultless. I emailed previously to ask if it was possible to have adjacent rooms with a nice view to make the stay special for my friend. We arrived at approx 1.30 and as our rooms were not quite ready, we left our bags with the concierge and went into the city. When we returned at midnight, we were delighted to have been allocated adjacent rooms both with wonderful views of the city and one was a wonderful upgraded suite. There was a slight hitch as the standard room was a double although I had specifically requested two twin rooms. However, after I made a call to the front desk, even though it was very late by this time, arrangements were made for an extra bed to be provided (which was very comfortable) along with a bottle of wine and some brownies to make amends and celebrate my friend's 40th birthday! We were delighted and it was lovely to be made to feel so special. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and we thought it was great value for money considering the deal we got through Expedia for the room and breakfast. The whole hotel including rooms and communal areas are spotlessly clean and tidy. The ensuite rooms are huge for a London with coffee/tea facilities, fluffy towels and wonderful toileties. The breakfast was great with eat as much as you like cooked breakfast, pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurt, tea/coffee, fruit juices etc which meant we didn't need any lunch that day. Although it takes a while to get into the city, it's worth it. The hotel is a short walk from the tube and takes approx 20 mins to get into the city, or we used the Thames Clipper river boat into the city leaving from a jetty 10 min walk away which was really quick and several landmarks can be seen from the river. There is also the convenience of Tesco Extra small supermarket, Subway and Coffee Shop a 2 min walk away. We really hope to be in a position to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Frogs13
Reviews.Content: Stayed the 15/7/11 for one night in a double room. Last minute booking at a cheaper rate. Excellent value for money. Hotel and rooms very clean. Staff execeptionally pleasant and friendly. Very helpful. If your considering staying in a 4 star hotel in Canary wharf then this is by far the BEST, having stayed in a few others (which i would NOT stay at again- one hotel being a stones throw from the Hilton) I can highly recommend this Hotel. If your consiidering adding breakfast or room only I can say its well worth the money to book it in advance. Full English brakfast and Continental available. Also had a chef making omlettes to order for people. Lovely fresh food, nice and hot. It easy to get into Central London via the tube early and late at night. Rooms are clean, comfortable and air conditioned. Would definately stay again. My room was on the same side as the train and yet I didnt hear any noise from them unlike staying at the Britannia where whilst in your room you can hear every train com in and go out.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissRachelCarr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous!! The rooms are modern more like an expensive apartment than a hotel. The staff are wonderful! We came back from a long day sightseeing to a turned down bed with a chocolate and robe and slippers laid out. As a regular traveller to London for weekends I will definitely choose this hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go back to this great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Mari08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 8th July.Due to flight times we arrived very early and yet were checked in quickly and asked to go and have a coffee while they readied our room. We had access to the executive lounge which was really nice and within half an hour our room was ready. It was lovely and the bed had lots of pillows and two big cushions so it was very comfortable. There is a tv speaker in the bathroom so you can listen to the weather report while you brush your teeth.Breakfasts were very good although the veggie sausages are not so great but plenty else to choose from. Every single member of staff was extremely helpful and friendly without over doing it. This included the receptionists, the concierges, breakfast and restaurant staff, room service and executive suite staff. The location is wonderful. Very close to tube station and lots of nice bars and restaurants. The whole area had a lovely feel to it.There was also a big shopping mall and pretty gardens/parks to walk through or picnic in.I believe they are upgrading tvs which is good cos present ones are too small.The only thing I would change about this hotel would be to add a pool, but it's so good I would stiil always stay there when in London, pool or not.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!..had a relaxed,quiet,comfortable,enjoyable stay...”
Reviews.Author: ffl0wer
Reviews.Content: My Sister & I stayed here to spend some quality time with each other & sightsee as living at opposite ends of the country makes meeting up rather infrequent unfortunatly..anyway The Hotel was pristine & in the grandiose surroundings of Canary Wharf..about 15mins into central london, 3 tube stops within 5min walk (& a Tesco Extra which is usefull as room service is pricey)..only 1 tubestop from the O2 which is usefull..Our Free upgrade to Executive Room with the benefits of the Executive Lounge was great, just a shame we were too busy sightseeing to enjoy the complimentery afternoon tea & evening drinks in there..A varied Breakfst selection in a relaxed atmosphere..Huge room with panoramic view of London/River..Firm bed..good nights sleep..we were highly amused that there are speakers in the bathroom..nice smelling designer toiletries..minimal noise from the DLR but not enough to disturb..complimentary choc cake in our room upon our return on the first evening was a thoughtfull touch..i will reccomend this hotel to anyone who will listen to me!..Hope to return at least twice more this year & having never stayed at The Hilton previously this is the only place I will ever stay when i come to the capital now.its not in a touristy,noisy area..but it is in Canary Wharf which speaks volumes in itself!..ohh & the Audi Garage accross the road is easy on the eye!!..

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: DanyaV
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Canary Wharf business center, so it's a wonderful place to stay if you go to the business trip. It takes about 5-10 minutes to walk to the shopping center and restaraunts. The restaraunt located at the ground floor is excellent. Breakfasts are manifold and tasty. The best about this hotel is staff. Staff is not only friendly but really helpful. They can assist you in organizing your evening knowing everything about nearby bars, pubs and restaraunts. Pity that a hotel rooms have no wi-fi, but wi-fi can be acessed at the lobby. Everything else about rooms is ok - rooms are clean and nice. Of course this hotel might not be the best option if you come as a tourist but it fits perfectly if you come for a business.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: angelinaballerina
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived - being unsure of where the car park was - the staff were friendly and helpful - the receptionist coming out onto the street to make sure we knew where we were going, we were met with unfailing courtesy. The room was lovely and clean with everything we needed and the bathroom particularly good we had two excellent nights sleep in a very comfy bed.We were staying at the hotel to attend a show at the O2 and the tube was five minutes away and we only needed to go one stop to get there. We were also able to go into the heart of London in about thirty minutes. Breakfast was really really good - plentiful,hot and tasty with a superb choice - the staff again attentive and police without being obsequeous. I really cannot think of one negative and am surprised anyone else can !

Reviews.Title: “An excellent surprise!”
Reviews.Author: MariMcG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as it was near Victoria Dock where I was taking part in The Great London Swim. We arrived early to drop off the luggage and although our room was not ready we checked in and returned at 2pm. The reception staff were efficient and friendly and even remembered us from earlier and asked all about the swim. We had booked a King Hilton Executive Hot Deal via Hotels.com and what a bargain it turned out to be. The room was very spacious with a HUGE bed and a very nice bathroom serviced with Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries and very very fluffy towels. We were on the 14th floor and had views across the Thames towards the dome and beyond. The surprise part came when we were told that as part of the 'deal' we were entitled to use the executive lounge and partake of the complimentary afternoon tea - sandwiches, scones and cakes. There was also a 'free' evening buffet but we did not have this as we hit the town. In the morning breakfast was also taken in the executive lounge and there was an excellent choice of everything you could possibly want and more. Overall this was an excellent stay and for the money (£119) fantastic value, especially if you avail yourself of the extras!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the complainers this place is excellent”
Reviews.Author: skyinthepieCheshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a family weekend.. We had two rooms with connecting door, both were excellent in all respects spacious and spotlessly clean. Cant fault any aspect of hotel or service. This place is vastly superior to many London city centre hotels with larger rooms and better sleep quality. Breakfast had an amazing seletion with all staff friendly and attentive. Good conections to city via jubilee line. Would reccomend without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for O2”
Reviews.Author: anna68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Sunday night to visit the O2. Its a fantastic locations, just 5 min walk to the tube and one stop to the O2. The hotel is not your typical Hilton, way more funky and fresh. Room was spacious and had a massive bed and a great strong/hot shower. Breakfast in the morning was very comprehensive and all in all this hotel was well worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about internet.”
Reviews.Author: wells67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with family before a family wedding in London. Was upgraded to a deluxe room due to overbooking. Very nice hotel, lovely breakfast. Pity there is no free wifi anywhere in the hotel, not even the lobby!. Stayed in budget accommodation on the rest of our trip around Europe and Asia and ALL had free wifi (most in our rooms) except this hotel, very disappointing, especially when most people will be staying in touch with family via the internet. Also amazed that we were charged 5 pounds for a "tray" with our room service meal....if there had been an option of no tray I would have been more than happy for it to come just on a plate!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but”
Reviews.Author: Um_viajante
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for a conference at the Excel. Location is fantastic for Canary Wharf, good for Excel, but hardly justifiable if you're visiting London. Positive points: Hotel is very clean, front desk friendly, fantastic elevators, room was large and very quiet. Breakfast was very good. Negative points: My bed was too low, well below my knee level, and the mattress too soft. Had back pain every morning. TV was too small, with limited channel choice, and a poor remote control. No wi-fi in room, no free wi-fi in the lobby, room's cable connection was 15 pounds/day - but was stable and speedy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: AbbyGemma
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed here from 17th-19th June. We'd booked a trip to London for her birthday weekend, and had tickets booked for the ballet at the O2 on the Saturday night. We got the tube to Canary Wharf then got a bit lost trying to find the hotel (I hadn't properly checked how to get there and the tube station has a lot of exits!) We asked a policeman though and it turns out it's only about a 5 min walk. I had emailed in advance to say we'd probably arrive at around 1pm (check in is usually 3pm), and I also mentioned that it was for my Mum's birthday. We arrived at around 1.30pm and checked in no problem and we told that we had been upgraded to an executive room. We were really pleased and went up to our room on the 13th floor (in a super speedy lift!) and found a fab, large room with a great view and lovely Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, bathrobes and slippers and complimentry water. The bathroom was huge (with a seperate shower) and all very clean and comfortable. We went out for a few hours that afternoon and got back to the hotel at around 5.30pm to find chocolate cake and balloons in the room with a card from the management saying Happy Birthday. I thought this was a lovely and very kind touch and my Mum loved it! We had dinner in the restaurant that night which was very tasty. There was then a power cut for a couple of hours so we stayed in the bar, but the staff took fantastic care of us, provided complimentary drinks and kept us updated about what was going on. A few people in the bar were getting a bit annoyed but it was not the hotels fault (turns out a lot of the area had been without power!) and we felt that they did everything they possibly could to make the situation easier! The whole thing was dealt with in a completely professional manner. The beds were seriously comfortable (I didn't want to get up!) and the breakfast was honestly the best I've ever seen in a hotel - a HUGE range of food and definately something for everyone from a cooked breakfast to fruit to breads to cold meats and cheese (to name a few!) The closeness to the o2 was fab and only took about 5 mins on the tube (to North Greenwich). It's a great hotel to stay in if you're going to an even there, but it's also really easy to get into the centre of London (about 15mins to Waterloo) I'd definately stay in the hotel again. We were thrilled with how well we were looked after and we had a really special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettRowe
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay. We had to travel a little further to the tourist spots we came to see, but we were so close to the tube station that it was no bother. The hotel appears to be brand new. Wonderful staff, we had a nice view and a large room (for London). I would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: gorpalm
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend break here at the start of June, 2nd time at this property. Love the docklands location, great to jump over to Greenwich, or explore the shops and restaurants of Canary Wharf. They were very good w communications prior to my stay, with emails from reception and restaurant asking me about my room requests and promoting their dinner service, respectively. Room wasn't ready when I checked in, they offered an alternative but as I requested a particular room number (17), end of corridor and larger than the rest, it was easy to leave luggage w the concierge and have late lunch over in Canary Wharf. They phoned when the room was ready, and luggage was already in room when I got there - Pretty good service! Breakfast service also no complaints - there was prior warning from the hotel that breakfast would be busy this weekend because of a number of groups staying - I think I queued for 10-15mins to get a table, but had my kindle so it was no hardship, and service was always faultless, considerate and smiling despite how busy it was. Ice machine in the lift lobby on every floor such a US style boon, much better than ordering up ice each time you needed it. However, this leads me onto the lip-pursing surprise of a £5 charge on every room service order. Frankly it's a hateful trend. I love room-service, part of the joy of staying at a 4 or 5* property is room service. A room service charge is like being charged thrice for the privilege - once to stay at the hotel, second time for the food, third time for them to bring it to your room. They don't hide it as a service charge for tipping purposes as the chit you sign still has space to add a tip, so its cash that drops straight to the bottom line for the hotel. Bathroom on the smallish size (especially when compared to the big deluxe room) but serviceable, water pressure seems a little eco-minded, slow running and quite aerated - a bit of a disappointment. Lovely linens and towels though, and bathrobes super soft and fluffy.

Reviews.Title: “Communication is an art form...........”
Reviews.Author: Fatcat153
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a Friday and Saturday night, booked through Hotwire and got a cracking rate so all things considered we were looking forward to the stay. When we arrived, we were advised that due to there being a conference on, we had been upgraded to an Executive Room - all good so far ! Room was very nice, clean and spacious with all you could need in it - Mini Bar was very expensive. Bottled water was a nice touch, I thought the TV could have done with being a bit bigger personally. We noticed all over the room there was reference to the Executive Lounge so we thought we would give it a try - we tried to get in for Breakfast on the Saturday, only to be told that we were not allowed we had a free upgrade that covered the room but not the lounge - ok, I’m aware that it was pushing our luck a bit, however the way we were told was indefensible. There were several people in the lounge and the Employee that told us had no idea of what the word discretion meant. We didn't know we were not allowed in as nobody told us that - all the media in the rooms told us we could use it. The employee on the desk could not of embarrassed us more, by announcing to pretty much all in the Lounge we were on a free upgrade and not entitled to access. We mentioned this to the Concierge on leaving the hotel to get breakfast in Canary Wharf (Breakfast @ £21 each is ridiculous so we went somewhere else !) all he said was "it says no lounge access on my screen" great, but we don’t have access to his screen ! He told us he would report it to the duty manager, we heard nothing more. No apology, not even an acknowledgement. This and the price of drinks really let the hotel down. we paid £16 for 2 vodka and cokes !!! - we worked out the mini bar is actually cheaper than the bar downstairs - no wonder it was empty ! I'm really loathed to give this a 3 start mark as I'm sure that with a couple of tweaks it could be a really nice hotel, however the communication and the expensive food and drink really let the hotel down. On a positive note, when we asked reception for more toiletries, they were very good and provided them straight away – clearly they can get some things right !

Reviews.Title: “bad service and bad bed!”
Reviews.Author: flightlevel36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip. My first choice hotel was sold out. Paid over 300 pounds/night. Got horrible front desk service and could feel every spring in the bed! No wireless in the room. Never going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What going the extra mile is all about”
Reviews.Author: EUtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business and what a delightful surprise. I am not much of a Hilton fan--I don't dislike Hiltons but I also don't go out of my way to book them. This hotel may have well changed my perception. First, the location: if you need to be in Canary Wharf this is superb. If you are visiting London for the first time be aware that this is quite a hike from the center of the city. With that said, from the minute I checked in I was impressed with the well trained staff. Check in was painless and fast. I threw three items to the dry cleaners on the first morning after check in and they were done by the late afternoon and delivered in gorgeous suit bags--completely first class. Third night I was feeling a bit under the weather--went down to the concierge who recommended a fabulous Indian restaurant, Bengal Quay, which was steps away from the hotel. He didn't have a menu so he walked me over to the restaurant and waited there outside until I ordered! When I told him I was returning in 15 minutes to pick it up, he told me that was nonsense and immediately arranged for the food to be delivered to ME. After I got back to my room he phoned (about 30 minutes later) to be sure that I had received it. Aside from the truly well trained and lovely staff, the hotel itself is modern, stylish, and comfortable. The beds are fantastic and the rooms are spacious. Breakfast is also delicious. Kudos to management--your mission is apparent in your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, cant fault it”
Reviews.Author: Travelagent777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with colleagues on a showaround. Standard Hilton Feel, had no problems. Room was nice (deluxe double). Had good facilities, didnt get time to see the Executive Lounge The Chef made us a brilliant meal in the morning and the food in general for breakfast was nice Cannot fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Trust them with your Visa/Master cards.”
Reviews.Author: ele001
Reviews.Content: Hotel it self with facilities is okey, and just meets quality you would expect from this chain. Staff is very polite but are not trained on payment part. Thus for us they tripple booked the initial amount on card, waisted half a day trying to get bill right and at the end did not know how to process a simple reverse of mistake they made. A month later and I am still waiting for some of that amount to be unblocked... They had no idea what is internet booking, or hotelclub..... And of course internet is GPB 15 for a day, one in business centre does not work... I will certainly stay in a different place next time..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel can't wait to go again in July!”
Reviews.Author: Cat111
Reviews.Content: I have already booked to come here with my husband on 1st July for 2 nights for our first wedding anniversary so was over the moon to find myself here earlier than that on a business trip with work. Thought I could check the place out beforehand! Although I stayed in a standard room the room was a good size for London and spotlessly clean...everything looks brand new. The staff were extremely helpful and seemed to enjoy their jobs. We are staying in a suite when we visit again in July so I will post another review afterwards and let you all know how that was! Sonia De Gioia

Reviews.Title: “A lovely clean hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: fredic
Reviews.Content: Hadn't stayed at a Hilton for a while but this one certainly will make me look at that chain again. We had to wait a few minutes to check in which wasn't a problem but still received an apology. They accommodated an early check in which really helped us being able to drop our bags off and upgraded us to an executive room. The room was spacious, the bed huge and so comfortable I could have slept in for ages. Lovely bathroom and toiletries. Breakfast was efficient in a very airy restaurant. Lots of choice of food cooked and prepared to a high standard. We were slightly concerned about the transport connections as the hotel is in a business district at the weekend. We need not have worried. The hotel is close to 3 tube stations (Canary Wharf is on both DLR and Jubilee line too) and we never had to wait more than 1 minute for a train.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and calm”
Reviews.Author: LLMac16
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly on business. The (standard) rooms are massive, clean and nicely decorated. Huge bathroom. Plenty of storage space, safe included, iron+ board, hairdryer, mini-bar, flat screen TV with satellite channels + the usual Hilton inclusive toiletries etc. Nice gym. Very convenient for Canary Wharf, 5 mins walk from the tube station and the main business area. Always my hotel of choice if staying in this area. However, it's very popular and often fully booked so book ahead if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: Mariarti
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just foe one night on a business trip and this was just amazing. The room was new and spotless, the bathroom was clean and also new. Very helpful staff. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshiregirl76
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through last minute.com a few months ago, having never been to a hilton nor canary wharf. Easy to find and can not fault the staff friendliness from reception to chamber maids. There was an event happening at the hotel during our stay but this did not affect us. We were going to the O2 and used the thames clipper service to get there and back. Also used this to travel down to westminster and london aquarium. Extremely quiet, no noise even though the DLR is very close. Room spotless and breakfast extremely good, every food choice covered. Will definitely be booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - shame it was so busy”
Reviews.Author: BedfordshireStupot
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the hotel or the staff - both fantastic but what was supposed to be a relaxing weekend was more than a little spoilt by a large event taking place at the hotel. Not something you expect at a weekend. The lobby was always very busy, at times it was difficult to get into and out of the hotel and there was always a very long queue for the lifts, on one occasion we had to wait 10 minutes then as people were using the lifts to move between the lower floors it always took ages once you were in the lift as well. We would very much have appreciated being informed of this event and given the chance to rebook on another weekend (staff told us such events only take place a few times a year) and we were warned not to have breakfast in the main restaurant due to likely queues, but the executive louge was lovely. Would stay here again certainly, but only if we knew there was no event on - overall rating based on what I would rate the hotel without any events on.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a lovely treat!”
Reviews.Author: Tamsk72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. Stayed at this hotel to be near to the O2 for Roger Waters gig. (which was fantastic) It was also my Boyfriends birthday. On arrival at the hotel we were greated by very pleasant staff and had the suprise of a free upgrade to a juniour suite. We had access to the executive lounge where we could have afternoon tea whilst our room was being made ready. The room was fantastic with a great view from a huge window. There were also balloons in the room! A huge bed (which was so comfy) A seperate seating/lounge area with TV/DVD and cinema sound. The bathroom was large with both a bath and shower. Toiletries were of good quality, plenty of towels, bathrobes and slippers. We also had yet another suprise of two large bits of chocolate fudge cake brought to us with Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the plate. It was so large my boyfriend couldn't eat it all (more for me!) When we came back of an evening our bed was turned down and soft lighting was on in the room along with classic FM (which also gets piped into the bathroom) with chocolates on the bed with our robes and slippers put out. (yet another lovely touch) Reccomend having breakfast brought to the room and pay the extra! second morning we went down for breakfast into the restaurant, the food was lovely with a huge choice and all freshley prepared. Pancakes and waffles are to die for! All in all very good service, good food. Staff very pleasant and friendly. Put the icing on the cake and a huge smile on our faces. Great for the O2 one stop away on the tube. Also reccomend a fantastic Italian restaurant Amerigo Vespucci about 5 mins walk from hotel on Mackenzie Walk. Book this hotel you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TJMS_1
Reviews.Content: My wife booked an executive room at this hotel to celebrate my 30th birthday. From the point we checked in, everything was taken care of and we had a wonderful time. Little treats in the room in the evening was a nice touch.. The only minor issue was that the quality of breakfast was average at the main restraunt and that the plates & glasses used in this restraunt were not very clean. Overall a very good stay!!!!! Will recommend this hotel...We will definitly come back in the future

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: pjohnno99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family when we went to see Barry Manilow at the O2. The hotel was the best and nicest I have ever stayed in. On check-in the staff made us feel very welcome and valued. The room was spacious and very clean and of high spec. The best part of our stay (apart from the concert) was the Cinnamon Restaurant on the ground floor. We dined on two nights and they had a fantastic 3 course set menu for £20. The food was great and the service was exceptional, the right balance of friendliness and efficiency. The breakfast buffet was first class and all the staff were friendly, polite and helpful. The Maitre D, Stephen was very friendly and greeted us each day with a smile and was asking us how we enjoyed the concert, he had a great rapport with all the customers and staff. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: sprig63
Reviews.Content: Although a little out of Central London, it is worth considering The Hilton Canary Wharf. My wife and I have made 2 stays here now (both times junior suite). The quality and cleanliness is 1st class. Best to go for an executive room as you get a free breakfast in the executive lounge. Try and get a south facing room (views of the river Thames), it's is an extra bonus worth having. We have found on both visits that the room is spotless and everything worked well. On our first visit, we dined at the hotel and although the food was fine, the restaurant lacked soul and was pretty much empty. There are some great restaurants locally and you can easily get boat trips 10 minutes away. All in all, the value of this hotel probably beats all of London and the standard is very high. And in reality, places such as Covent Garden are only 20 minutes away by tube. equally, very close to Greenwich and the O2 arena.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time. Would stay Again”
Reviews.Author: ryuenau
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Price/value was great since it was located in the business district. Although a little far from Heathrow airport (1hr 20 mins by Tube), is was easy to get there. We took the Piccadilly Line tube from LHR to Green Park and transfered to the Jubilee line to Canary Wharf. At Canary Wharf its a short walk thru the wintergreen building and over a small foot bridge. Bought a day trip tube card which only cost 8 pounds. Note, that when transfering at Green Park there are two places where you need to go up stairs about 15 steps each. We had small carry on luggage so it wasnt a problem. From the hotel its extremely easy to get to all the sites. Canary Wharf tube connects you directly to Westminster as well as London Bridge. There is a wonderful restaurant around the corner, Hazev, that had excellent Anatolian/Turkish cuisine. It was our first time to London. Although the city is easy to walk, we found it most efficient to see all the sites in our 3 days utilizing the double decker tour buses. At first we tired to do without, but since we didnt do as much homework on this trip as we usually do we found ourselves a little lost. Big Bus tours was offering a 24hr pass for 27 pounds or 48hr pass for 32. Buses run from 9am to 6pm. We chose the 48hr. Had a great time. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on multiple occasions when I've needed to be in the Canary Wharf area for work, and I cannot fault this hotel. Make sure you don't confuse it with the Docklands hotel, which is altogether much worse. The hotel is located on the Marsh wall, just across (via a pedestrian footbridge) from the main towers of Canary Wharf. It's probably a leisurely 5 minute walk to Citi / HSBC etc. It's nice and modern inside, and the rooms are very spacious and modern by London standards. The room decor is some of the nicest Hilton decor I've seen in London, and the beds are very comfortable. Perhaps my only two minor criticisms of this hotel are: - Expensive broadband in room (as with virtually all hotels I stay in now) - Small TV Room service meals are always well made in this hotel and delivered on time. Staff are very friendly and seem to make a real effort. I used to divide my time between the Marriott (also excellent) and this hotel, but I'm now likely to use this one more because the rooms seem marginally better. I'd say the only factor in deciding between the Marriott and Hilton in canary wharf is which loyalty scheme works best, as they're both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern hotel, perfect base for Docklands”
Reviews.Author: djl-uk
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. A little disappointed we didn`t get a view over the docks, but it didn`t really matter, as only here for one night, and we only mention it as instead we had a room with the Docklands light railway beneath, but the room was so well soundproofed you wouldn`t have known, nor was there any road noise or noise at all come to that, which can be a rarity. A tip about the Leisure Club/Gym, there`s no swimming pool, but there is a Sauna and steam room, HOWEVER, if you want to use these, let reception know in advance if you can, as the steam room takes half an hour to reach temperature and the sauna two hours to do so, if we remember correctly, as the gym seems to be unsupervised. The Buffet Style Breakfast was fine, with the exception of the orange juice offered to you at table, which was not pure. The Bacon deserves a special mention, as they have crispy and non crispy bacon on the buffet, which is a plus, as it caters for both tastes. Ice machines are available near the lift, on each floor we would imagine. Location is fine for Docklands/Canary Wharf area, with South Quay station just down the road to the left, and Canary Wharf 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir28
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights while in London to attend an event at The O2. The room was large with good quality fixtures and fittings. It was particularly nice to have a modern hairdryer and complementary bottled water. The bathroom was also of a good quality, the shower had good water pressure, the bath was a nice size and the in room slippers were a nice touch. The breakfast was included in the price and was excellent with a full range of cereals, breads and pastries, cold meats, cheeses, yogurts as well as a full hot buffet. The pancakes were a particular favourite of mine. The hotel is easy to get to and is in an excellent location for The O2, Only one stop away on the underground. Would certain recommend and will stay again next time I attend The O2.

Reviews.Title: “Nice One”
Reviews.Author: Audrey049
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, quiet, clean, comfortable, convenient to tube and DLR, good restaurants and shops nearby. Would certainly use again

Reviews.Title: “Good Room, Great Breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: Wrant
Reviews.Content: Fine for a short stay in London. The Journey to the hotel on the DLR shows you a good cross section of area. The actual are around of the hotel is a little disappointing but don't worry you will not be spending time there. The hotel is efficient and clean and the rooms are large and well equipped. Breakfast was excellent (£20) if not included in the room. Ignore the ground floor bar and use the hotel just as a base whilst you explore. If you are there for business it is fine. If you are sightseeing; Easy access to the City and associated sights Tower, St Pauls, HMS Belfast, The South Bank, Try a visit to the Monument I had never been there before and it was very quiet on a Sunday (not for fat people or the unfit) A short trip to Greenwich, I suggest getting off the Docklands Light Railway (DLR) at Island Gardens and Walking under the Foot Tunnel, then along the Thames East or up to the the Greenwich Observatory. 20 minute trip to the West End on the Jubilee Line.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place”
Reviews.Author: maridonna
Reviews.Content: I had a brilliant stay! Would recommend! Clean and sophisticated!

Reviews.Title: “Third Great Visit to Hilton Canary Wharf”
Reviews.Author: GirlsAboutTown
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hilton Canary Wharf again and were so pleased that we did. One of the receptionists remembered us from our first visit which was two years ago, and remembered my daughter's name from that time. The hotel has a very relaxed and friendly atmosphere and nothing is too much bother. Breakfast has everything you could wish for. So easy to get into central London as long as Jubilee Line is not playing up.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pgwkmt
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for - spotless hotel, great view, easy to deal with, parking on site at a reasonable price (for London!) and three or four minutes walk from a DLR station. A great price as well for this standard of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for the O2”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonSam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very easy to get to and only one stop on the underground to the O2, fantastic breakfast, lovely room, got upgraded for free! great shopping area right next door. Good bar just round the corner. On a minus point the bar staff were rude, we were ignored for ages, then told to sit down and they would come and take our order, but we waited for ages, then ended up going back up to the bar. Talking of bars, be careful not to take stuff out of your mini bar, as you get charged, it assumes you eaten/drunk it, but they didnt hesitate to make the bill correct once we checked it out, would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and VFM with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: uglowd
Reviews.Content: I have stopped at this hotel previously and was not disappointed on my return. I booked for 2 nights for 2 rooms back in the January sale. I was sent an email the week prior to going asking if anything could be done in advance and I stated that I was going to celebrate my Mothers 80th birthday and I would like adjoingin rooms if possible. I was emailed straight away and offered a upgrade which I accepted. On arrival we were greeted at the desk and my Mother was wished a happy birthday and we given a suite and executive room which were both excellent. It also gave us access to the executive lounge which was great to go and have a drink and take in the views of London. The pre and in hotel customer service was excellent and went way above what I have received in 5 star hotels and helped make the weekend even more special. Due to my mother being disabled I used taxis in and out of central London but the hotel is suitable for Docklands railway with disabled access and only 17 minutes from central London on the Jubilee line. I have stopped in other hotels in London but the Hilton at Canary Wharf is by far the best we have stopped in and we will definately return. Nice to know that some hotels do care about the customers, many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a 5 * experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tomas0804
Reviews.Content: 3rd brilliant stay in 9 months - that says it all! We've just returned from an extended B-day weekend in London and the experience from our (yet another) stay in Hilton Canary Wharf has been once again impressive! It all actually started few days prior our arrival with a pleasant email from Ms. Maria Lopez, the guests relations manager, recognizing that we are returning again and offering help with any arrangements or preferences we might need or have. I just mentioned that it will be a birthday celebration weekend and a room with a higher floor/view would be a nice treat. Well, of course it was taken care of! On our arrival we have been not only upgraded to a higher floor room with a beautiful view over canary wharf and London's city center, it was actually the executive floor with all related benefits. And the cherry on the top was a delicious cake and balloons in the room to recognize my B-day - what a surprise! The arrival and check-in was even more special thanks to Ms. Pei Ling on the reception who actually remembered us from our previous stay so we really felt like coming "home". Pei Ling's warm, friendly welcome, her care, attention to details and the positive attitude just made our day and last for entire stay. What else to say? Service perfect, staff professional, helpful and well mannered, food delicious, spotlessly clean. After our previous stay we thought that they can't surprise us, that staying in Canary Wharf Hilton couldn't get better. And actually they did it again!! This Hotel is clearly my nr. 1 choice in London and I will be always looking forward to stay there again. Once again a 5 * experience! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient docklands hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJ0nes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were going to a concert at the O2. a very comfortable hotel - we had an executive room with access to the esecutive lounge. Excellent breakfast and very helpful staff. The room was a very decent size, very quiet and convenient for the DLR. Greenwich was very accessible so we got the DLR there for dinner as the hotel restaurant seemed a little clinical. All in all, very good value for money and very comfortable room with a well appointed bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal birthday treat!”
Reviews.Author: gemma_walsh
Reviews.Content: Took my husband to London for his 40th birthday to see a show and stayed at the Hilton in canary Wharf, as i am 8 1/2 months pregnant i asked for a quiet room which they delivered. A really nice touch was i mentioned to the restaurant staff about booking a table as it was for a birthday, even though in the end we didnt eat in the restaurant they sent up some balloons and 2 pieces of fudge cake to our room with a happy birthday message and card We booked and had a Junior Suite room and i can honestly say its the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in! First time in months i have managed a full nights sleep :) With booking the Junior suite you get free access to the executive lounge which was fantastic, breakfast was from 7.30am until 11am and the choice was great even included bottles of fresh juice and coca cola Absolutely loved the place and all staff we incountered where so kind and helpful, definately going back for our anniversary complete with baby in tow!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julianb
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night recently as were were attending an event at the 02 and were very impressed with the hotel and in particualr the very helpful staff. The hotel is well situated near to both the tube and DLR and was very quiet. Checkin was very prompt and as we drove to the hotel we also used their own car park. Room was nicely furnished and large for London. Breakfast was great-although we had to queue for a table to queue moved very quickly and we were seated in less than 5 minutes. Breakfast was of a very high standard and the staff were constantly coming around and topping up your coffee and orange juice. Overall we were very impressed and will stay there again. The staff and their helpful attitude really helped to make our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for purpose”
Reviews.Author: fcg1959
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is convenient for the east side of London city or for the airport, this is ideal. The Docklands Light Railway is a dream to use and takes you right into the city of London from just a 3 mins walk from the hotel and could not be an easier walk with a wheelie suitcase. Check- in was welcoming and very efficient - they had already upgraded me to an Executive floor room before I even asked. The room was very large but maybe this was because it was at the end of the corridor. All the usual amenities you would expect although the towels were not particularly fluffy. The view from the window was excellent - towards the London Eye, although it was a long way away! I was concerned about the noise, but there was no need as it was incredibly quiet and peaceful. I ordered room service and did not eat in the restaurant for lunch - club sandwich was nice, mostly because the chicken was succulent. The toast was a bit dry. This was an overnight business trip, and did not return to the hotel until 23.30. One of the disadvantages of the area is lack of cafes/restaurants/coffee shops that open that late. There is a small centre of shops 2 mins walk from the hotel with the basics but I guess these are only open during the day. The Executive Lounge was closed, and I was hungry but I found a lovely chocolate dessert in my room - just what was needed! After a great night's sleep, breakfast in the Executve Lounge - good selection. I didn't use any of the leisure facilities, and internet connection is cable only in the bedrooms, not Wi Fi. Staff were friendly, hotel was very clean and the trip was made so much easier by the experience in this hotel. Would stay here any time I need to make a business trip to London. Thank you for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff, made our weekend away just perfect !”
Reviews.Author: lorsie6401
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to London several months ago and chose this hotel as were attending a couple of events at the O2. As a Hiton silver member I wrote in advance and asked if we could have a room with a nice view overlooking the city as it was a special occasion. On checking in, we were upgraded to an executive room with use of the compimentary executive lounge. The room was fantastic, one of the biggest hotel rooms I have stayed in and with a stunning view of the city. The location of the hotel is first class, only about 15 minutes by tube from Canary Wharf into the heart of the city, and only one stop from the 02. Every single member of staff we encountered was pleasant, friendly and helpful and the service in the executive lounge with complimentary snacks, afternoon tea and drinks was first class. I have travelled extensively on business and stayed in many hotels and this was certainly one of the best. I am already planning my next trip to London and wouldnt think of staying anywhere else. Thank you so much Hilton Canary Wharf!.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really to complain about here and that's a first!”
Reviews.Author: CountryLady2
Reviews.Content: The car park was a bit tricky to find but having pulled up outside and asked the concierge, he was really helpful ... and it didn't seem a bother to him either, what a refreshing change! The chap who checked us in was friendly and this made good first impressions. The standard room was much larger than expected, all really good quality. Breakfast was fabulous - it's often difficult for me to get my 'daily dose' of porridge but there it was, as a standard offering and delicious too with the nuts and fruit that I love! All of the staff were very friendly except for one non-committal lady working on the bar at night - everything would have been perfect except for her apparent grumpiness but that wouldn't stop us from going there again - but I wouldn't want to pay more than the £106 b&b that we paid this time. Perfect location for the O2 as it's only one stop away on the tube and we were amazed at how easy it was to get into the city too. Wish I could have exactly that porridge and all those accompaniments every morning ... and what pillows were they, anyone know? They were fabulous and I had an amazing sleep - I need to buy some.

Reviews.Title: “Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: moneyworks
Reviews.Content: We took the Hilton offer before 31st March with 50% discount on room and breakfast rate. It turned out to be a fantastic decision. Their service deserved a full score. We arrived at the hotel around 9am in the morning. We were welcomed by very friendly staff. Later we were told that our room is ready and we can check-in immediately. Price - Value for $$$ with Hilton 50% offer. Room - The room is very spacious, cosy and clean. Food - The breakfast is excellent. Location - If I have to write a con about this hotel. I will say its location. It's in the middle of South Quay DLR and Canary Wharf tube. You have to walk 3-4 minutes from South Quay and 5-7 minutes from Canary Wharf to this hotel. It's really not a problem for most of the people... Special remarks - Since we had booked a day tour the next morning. We have asked the hotel to serve breakfast earlier instead of the normal timing. We were told they can serve it if the breakfast is ready before we leave the hotel. Nevertheless, the hotel prepared breakfast boxes for us to take away in the next day morning when they couldn't serve us before we leave the hotel. We were prepared to leave the hotel without breakfast knowing that it's our decision to go for an early day tour. We really appreciated the breakfast boxes. Excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “new hotel, good restaurant, soulless bar, incredibly polite staff, safe parking”
Reviews.Author: lizandtone
Reviews.Content: I only had a very short stay at this hotel, arrived at about 6pm, had dinner and a few drinks, and left at 07.30 the following morning without breakfast (opted for extra 20 mins in bed). On arrival I had a little bit of trouble finding the entrance to parking garage, but after hanging around like a lemon for few minutes I drove up to a big "garage door" and spotted the hotel intercom and the concierge buzzed me in. There was plenty of room to park, and for £20 per night I thought that was reasonable for the neighbourhood. I went upstairs to reception and almost had to beat the concierge off from taking my meagre luggage, they were very service focused! The receptionist was really polite and friendly and helpful and check in was painless. There are three spacious and very smooth lifts (never been in a Mitsubishi lift before) and the corridors upstairs were wide, spacious and nicely decorated. I was shocked when I opened the bedroom door; the room was really large for a London Hotel. Nice modern sleek lines, and a very comfortable bed. Internet was £15 per night, which I thought was a lot so didn't bother, and the phone signal was a bit intermittant too. We were going to head into Canary Wharf for dinner but one of our colleagues was late so we used the hotel restaurant instead. I'm veggie and there were a couple of options for me which was encouraging. The waitress (I wish I'd noted her name) was delightful, very charming and helpful, bringing some warmth to the slightly sterile environment that the modern design of this hotel restaurant. The food was superb, nicely presented, tasty ingredients and some imaginative combinations. For dessert I ordered the trule test of a restaurant, the chocolate fondant. It was perfect, slightly crunchy on the outside but moist on the inside and very very chocolatey!! I had a good night's sleep, and it nice looking out of the window and seeing the bright lights of docklands. Shower was good, and nice bathroom sundries. Checkout was easy, quick and painless (and firiendly). If you turn right out of the hotel entrance on foot, you can walk across to Canary Wharf, which is pretty impressive if you've never seen it before. If you turn left however you'll end up in Millwall Dock, which is interesting but a bit more urban and "everyday" in places. There were quite a few lads on bikes wearing hoodies hanging around, not doing anything wrong, but just a warning if you find that kind of thing intimidating (I'm sure there is no need, they looked pretty harmless to me). I paid £184 room rate (plus VAT), £20 for parking and £45 for dinner, so my total bill was close to £300. I'd stay here again no worries if work was paying again, but if I was staying there myself I think I'd be looking for a special offer! Nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZIACormwall
Reviews.Content: Spacious room and bathroom, comfortable beds. Clean and modern. Good breakfast with plenty of options. Lovely Turkish restaurant just around the corner on South Quay. Easily accessable via Jubilee line/DLR. Bit souless but hey!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: ademiddlesbrough1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Canary Wharrf Hoel for a weekend break and to see a show. On arrival the staff were superb and on leaving we were always met with a smile. On arrival we were given a free upgrade to the Executive floor. The food was of top quality and we took advantage of the special three course menu for £20 per person. Unbelievable value for a top London hotel. The hotel once again is built on the staff who make it such a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, service mixed”
Reviews.Author: lava_tory
Reviews.Content: This place has seriously big rooms for a 4* hotel in London. Big big big and lost of contemporary dark wood furnishings. Bed was decent but with the amount of space they could easily put a king in as standard (all the room categories except the corner suites are the same size). The condition was pretty good, some of the veneer on the wood was showing early signs of splitting at the corners and they'll want to address this soon.
